Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, best in Spore”
Reviews.Author: palamitwipro
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Spore 5 times & this was the best stay ever. Super stay for Honeymoon. Best location.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Mervelik
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel a week ago. The rooms are very small and they fitted a 3rd bed in the middle of the other two so it was like a giant bed but there were no room for us to even walk. We tried to reason with the receptionist but no luck. Also no free wifi, $8 per hour. The breakfast was not impressive as well. Not worth a dime.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Ravi8587
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel in december 2011 along with my wife..our booking was through a travel agent and we had no idea of the hotel...it is a nice hotel situated on queens road,the service is of good quality but for indians,we hardly got any indian food...as regards to rooms and other areas,cleanliness was maintained....u get a nice view of the street from the rooms in higher floors..there are some nice shops near the hotel to buy some souvenirs from singapore...overall it was a good value for money....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, old room”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: I needed a place that was easy in the wallet in a better location. I should've looked elsewhere. I got a musty old room with old fixtures. There are other places in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maziarsh
Reviews.Content: I like to write very sharp: 1- location: very good. (near to MRT, Bus stations, Hip Hop Bus Stations, Bugis Area) 2- Clean rooms, good room service 3- great and delicious inside hotel food. 4- average breakfast. 6- helpful staff (especially the one in my pic). 7- internet is not free (I think in many Singapore hotels this is same). recommend to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed as Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: SuzieVL
Reviews.Content: This is good value as part of a Singapore Stopover holiday. Location is great - really close to the MRT. Beware Wi-fi is purchased as an hour for $6 and must be used in one go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: coco-rco
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean tidy rooms, friendly polite knowledgeable staff, very good value for money, walking distance to Chinatown And Little India.MRT station 30 seconds walk away. five minutes walk to the chimes night life area. excellent authentic hawker eating area across the road. would definitely stay again and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DobRock
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the great location - in the busy central region but on a tranquil and quiet street. The rooms were perfectly adequate for a one week stay, very clean and well maintained. Sleep quality was excellent, I can`t recall hearing any noices at night. The breakfast was dissapointing - tasteless and with very limited choice, the same things for 7 days. If not included - don`t bother to pay for breakfast - there are many better options throughout the city. The staff were attentive and polite with the exception of the receptionists - they were polite only at check-in and completely indifferent afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well priced and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: swift66
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotels in Singapore that it's often really difficult to know which one to choose. This hotel is in a great location and, whilst having a really grim exterior, is perfectly acceptable on the inside. We had a fairly quick check-in with a very friendly receptionist and our bags were taken to our room by a very enthusiastic doorman/bellboy. He demonstrated everything in the room and was very keen to impress. The beds were comfortable, the linen clean and white and the pillows plump. The bathroom was also clean and tidy. The only gripe was the shower curtain. I hate shower curtains generally and I swear this one had a mind of it's own and was determined to allow me only about 6 inches between it and the wall opposite. The breakfast was fine. The usual selection of hot and cold food - asian and western - with plenty of coffee and tea and juices. Great location next to Bras Basah MRT stop so the train from the airport is virtually door-to-door. Bugis market is but a short walk away. To be honest this hotel is in such a great location that you can walk to pretty much wherever you want to go. We walked back from Orchard Road and also back from the Marina Bay Sands hotel, via a number of air-con malls of course! Whilst the wi-fi is $6 per hour, we simply asked if we could use the internet to check-in for our flights and were directed to the office where they allowed us to use a computer and print our boarding cards. On check-out, the hotel called a cab for us and it arrived within 3 minutes of the call being placed. The cost of the cab to the airport was c.$23.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great location”
Reviews.Author: DaisyClover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for $80 on a Singapore Airlines stopover package which was excellent value, given the outrageous cost of rooms in Singapore these days. I last stayed at the Royal @Queens in January 2009 just after it's most recent renovation. It has been well maintained and I was again comfortable here. The room was not too small and it has everything that you expect in a decent Singapore hotel: flat screen television, minibar, coffee making, toiletries. We were checked in and out promptly with efficiency and courtesy. On arrival when we got to our room and realised that we had been given a twin rather than a double, a call to reception prompted a staff member to arrive to escort us to another room in a very timely manner. I consider this kind of responsiveness the hallmark of a good hotel. I especially love the location of this place, close to Waterloo Street and my favourite food courts and vegetarian restaurants at the Fortune Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natscan
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with this hotel but there was nothing exceptional about it either. I got a decent deal due to booking with Singapore Airlines on a Singapore stopover holiday. Had I paid full price I would have give 1.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gingerelsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights from 21st Feb - 23rd Feb on our way back from New Zealand. It was very clean and the room was well equipped and the twin beds were really comfortable. Our package which was very reasonable priced included transfers to and from the airport, an early check in (8a.m.) and a late check out (6p.m.) and 50% discount of meals which made the breakfast a reasonable S$16. We booked through Singapore Airlines office in Auckland. The location is good and there are a lot of restaurants and cafes within walking distance. It is a 20 minute walk to the start of Orchard Street if you don't mind the humidity. The Singapore Museum is a 15 min walk away and the MRT is very handy. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The problem with success”
Reviews.Author: Carlo T
Reviews.Content: I was appalled by our reception. Two cars had been allowed to block the driveway for one particular family. After an interminable wait, our vehicle was finally allowed to pull up and our luggage was discharged, but no one from the hotel came to help us. Bizarrely, this hotel has done away with the reception counter and replaced it with individual desks, so you feel like you're going up to your boss when you check in. With this ridiculous design innovation the hotel is telling you who's in charge, and it isn't you. But I deliberately chose this hotel—friends stayed there during a previous visit of mine—because of its excellent location. It is right across the Singapore Art Museum and just down the road from Nathan. Raffles is a short stroll away and the exquisitely Gothic Chimes even nearer. The design of the rooms, with a glass bowl sink over a glass counter in the bathrooms and flat screen TVs in front of the beds, is now looking a little dated, but their condition is still mint. It's undoubtedly the value of the quality of the rooms and the hotel's prime location that draws heavy traffic to the hotel. Unfortunately, the traffic seems to have worn down the staff, and, to me, the staff manning those ludicrous desks seem to have been swept away into a torpor by a profound sense of futility. What can it all mean, they seem to be thinking to themselves as they check you in. Maybe they should visit the art museum to get over it.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Johno7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel for 4 nights. Clean and the majority of the staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was a little pricy at S$32. Located one and half blocks from the Bras Basah subway station. Excellent Singapore subway system cost less then S$3.00 to the Airport. WI-Fi in the lobby that was fairly stable. They also had a business center that I used for flight check in. In the center of everything and the subway nearby that crisscrosses the Island. Plenty of restraints on Victoria Street. Did not use there bar or restaurants in the hotel except for the breakfast buffet. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is superb”
Reviews.Author: monkir
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Singapore Air stopovers. This worked really well as the transfer was included in the price and other incentives and freebies too. The hotel is fairly modern and the room, although not the biggest was excellent. The lighting system was very up to date with touch pad switches for all lights. Breakfast was good enough although not stunning and the dining area is a bit "canteenish" Breakfast was half price with the package we booked. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful when we asked any questions or for advice. The best thing though is the location. It is just a couple of minutes walk to Raffles Hotel and to the bus stop for the singapore airline hop on hop off bus that travels round the city. This was free with our package. We used it to go to the Singapore Flyer - 2 stops away - and then travelled on it to sight see the rest of the city. We noticed while on this bus that a lot of the other hotels are miles from anywhere and need transport to reach the attractions/shops. I walked from the hotel to Clarke Quay - about 20 minutes but I do walk slowly. Overall I would recommend this hotel for a stopover holiday. It has everything you require including free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: system_error
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a Formula 1 event. It's very near where the event was held. Very good location, walking distance from metro station and you can get to anywhere in Singapore. Room is clean, check in and out no problem, but the staff at the lobby aren't very helpful with luggage, even if they see you having a hard time already. The staff with whom we left our bags for safekeeping after we checked out is a bit rude, but at least they have this facility for safekeeping while we still have time to explore before we leave for the airport. I may come back to this place if there were no other cheaper hotels of the same class in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A good stopover option”
Reviews.Author: olgaginger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is offered for a stopover holiday in the B group of hotels. This means it is not too expensive. However, it is located to the best advantage of a stopover tourist - quite in the centre of Singapore and close to every central site. It is not more than a five minutes walk to Bras Basah subway station, about 30 to 40 minutes to the Flyer, about the same to the nearest boat station. So you may get yout and start walking in any direction you may choose. I spent almost one and a half day there - arrived in the evening of day 1 and booked the second day in full, as I was leaving late at night. The room was wide and clean, there is nothing superfluous in the design, just the necessary things. The bathroom was also roomy, everything there is operable and cleam, What else can I say? It was a little bit noisy outdoors, as there is a kind of restaurant in the same street, and they had a sort of celebration there (a wedding, I guess, or something as great), but it did not last for too long - maybe ten minutes of noise in the whole night. Otherwise the street the hotel is in is not busy at all, there is hardly any traffic at all. I overslept my breakfast, so cannot tell anything about it. What I really did not understand, is why they switched on the central air conditioner at some moment, when I was away from the room on my second day. When I returned back from my city rush, it was as frosty as during the Russian winter. Even the windows got damp from OUTSIDE (the thing I have never ever seen before). Maybe it was the maid, who arranged some cold weather inside after cleaning the room. Who knows... Anyway, as there was nothing of that kind on my first day, perhaps it is not an automatic thing, and probably I could settle it at the reception, but I was leaving on the same day, so I did not care. Anyway, the room got its right temperature very quickly, and there were no problems ever since. So I give it a "four" only for this slight disconvenience. All other aspects were simply fine: the staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and the sights nearby. The transfer service to and from the airport was also fine, not a minute was lost. One small advice to photographers: take care of your cameras, as air conditioning in public places is bitter (Royal hotel is not the only place that tries to compensate for the outdoor warmth). It will get your lense wet from inside as soon as you get outdoors. This may cost you a few precious minutes that you will be trying to wait till the fog disappears (I won't say anything about electronics, mine was fine after all). So when you are planning your route, try to arrange it so as not to mix in- and outdoors too much. P.S. The bright spot in my photos is not a picture or abstract painting - it is a wall of a building opposite the hotel. In overall, it gives a very specific view to the whole room, but it is not obtrusive - to see the abstractionism, you will have to look out the window.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. <2 min walk from Bras Basah metro station. A bit over priced. I expected better service for the price”
Reviews.Author: willwu2000
Reviews.Content: The location is the best selling point of this hotel. 7-8 min walk opposite direction of metro station lots of shops and a night market with diversity of food choices. Has in room safe to use, no extra charge. However, it was broken on arrival. Called front desk, staff came to check immediately, was unable to fix it. No attempt to fix or replace safe throughout our stay. Has a outdoor pool but we didn't use it. Came back to hotel early afternoon one day, staff was in room fixing bathroom sink. Staff had toilet plunger in bathroom sink. That was kinda disturbing. Breakfast buffet included. Food is average. Fruits selection was good and fresh. Hotel's interior looks better and is newer compared to its exterior. Had 2 broken lights on arrival. Called front desk, staff came up to check immediately, said will fix next day. Didn't happen. Called again the next day, was able to fix one light. Free wifi in hotel lobby. Network was not detectable for 3 of 5 days we were there. Staff said network was being fixed. Though when functioning, wifi was fast. Overall, we expected more for the price paid. Here are other 3-4 star hotels in same area for the same price we paid that are newer, has the same amenities, and dependable wifi (walked by daily and were able to detect their network from outside). I recommend this hotel if you can get low rate

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Bit Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Marlene N
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. The location is great. There is an underground station metres away and Orchard Road is within walking distance. The staff were not very helpful with tourist information but otherwise pleasant. Good security. You need room keycard to go up in elevator. There was a safe and free internet in the room (although first staff person I asked said there was a charge so ask again!) Room is small but no smaller than most hotel rooms. Bed was large enough for two adults plus our 10 year old son so didn't need to pay for extra bed which was another $50! Bathroom had shower over bath and plenty of hot water. Thought it was a bit strange that when we asked to stay an extra night, we were told it was cheaper to book online. After I was shown to a computer and it kept coming up no room available, staff member then checked and said "Sorry all booked up." He could have told me at the beginning! At the price we paid (AU$170 per bight), I wouldn't expect anything less. Be warned though, you need to add 10% service fee and 7% GST on top of price you get on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Fair, good location”
Reviews.Author: welshman279
Reviews.Content: Great location, ideal for exploring on foot. The hotel itself is tidy, with rooms having had a refresh in recent years. The check in staff however left a lot to be desired. No explanation of breakfast, the fact you can only use the elevator in conjunction with your room key, along with no help with our bags. Explore the surrounding area ( lovely little bars etc on the campus across the road) For a one night stop over this hotel is fine, but for any longer , do yourself a favour and pay more for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central and moderate price”
Reviews.Author: Alf Magne A
Reviews.Content: As a family of five we were her only one night and was happy with the location close to city centre and also the price for the rooms are good compared to other hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good for stopover”
Reviews.Author: edisondownunder
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 1 night under Singapore Stopover Holiday package so it included transfer to/from airport. The hotel is very close to MRT station, and has been refurbished so it feels new inside the room even though the room is small. Didn't try to have food in hotel as you can just go out to shops and eat. This hotel is good for short stay, and the price under SSH is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you booked room-only!!”
Reviews.Author: jkt_traveller
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was just horrible, no variety, everydays the same, not to mention they charged my 5 y.o daughter $ 23 for it even after i told them that i booked the room incl.breakfast for two and usually children under 12 can eat for free, anyway what could my toddler eat there that would possibly caused $23?!!!!! A total ripped off! Other than that location is good as its close to an MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Great location”
Reviews.Author: rence14
Reviews.Content: We had our yearly family reunion in Singapore last december 26. And instead of the usual big and famous tourist hotels located on Orchard rd or Marina Bay area, we decided to try this cozy little hotel near the Burgis area. We booked 5 rooms for 6 nights all on the same floor. My first impression of the hotel upon arrival (we arrived at the hotel around 10pm) was a typical 3 star hotel (no grand lobby, no overly helpful bellboy, no mini bar). But the room size was average around 25 sqm, the 2 single beds were comfy and the bathroom was not cramped. What impressed us the most was the great location since it is just an 8 min walk to Bugis Junction mall (one of my favorite malls, great for having young kids and teenagers) and 4min to the nearest 7-11. and just 2 min to the MTR. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families with young kids and teenagers. Although dont expect too much on the service side after all this is not a 5 star hotel. As for the price (we paid on average s$180++ a night during the peak christmas season) it was not too expensive considering it's good location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: BundaFab
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from Singapore and staying at the Hotel Royal @ Queens for 4 days 3 nights with my husband and our 2 years old son. The hotel added nice memory of Singapore for me and my family. The location is very perfectly just a few steps from MRT station, bus station and 7-11 stores for basic grocery. It is also locate near Singapore Art Museum. The room is very comfortable; the bed was comfortable not too soft and not to hard so just perfectly comfortable "see I wrote 3 words of comfortable because it is :)". The control panel for lamp, bell, "Clean up my room" & "Do not disturb" sign using a touch screen panel nice touch of modern look, the hot water is always available when you need it. The TV is a 32 Inch Flat Screen, the chairs in the room also comfortable. The hotel safety was also a plus point, since you will need the room key card to use almost all of the facility in the hotel such as elevators, gym, and swimming pool, so only the hotel guest and hotel employee have the access for it. It gives me a nice secure feeling. The breakfast buffet need improvement in its food variation, as an Indonesian I used to food with spice and flavor that is lack from this hotel meal. But overall for the breakfast buffet I give score of B+, good enough. The staff was very helpful and friendly, my compliments goes to Ms.Darlene the receptionist who was helping me by giving late checkout time since my flight back was at night so she gave me late check out at 2 pm. After we check out we can still store the luggage at the hotel, and they will tight all the luggage and give it a name tag, the name tag was given one for us also so when we want to take it we can just show the name tag and sign the book. Overall I really enjoy my stay at hotel Royal @ Queens, and will probably choose to stay there again if I have a chance go to Singapore again :)

Reviews.Title: “Standard Singapore rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: Fiver75
Reviews.Content: They are not kidding when they say that the Bras Basah MRT station is just a minute away – from the exit walk straight ahead and the hotel is only 100 metres away. Orchard Road and all its wonderful shopping is only a 5-10 minute walk. So all in all, the location is very good. The reception area is full of desks rather than an actual counter. Check in was quick, but the staff could have actually talked a bit – there was a lot of paper rustling and checking on the computer before I was finally done – it was all business. My room was great – a nice view of Singapore, a modest size and quite clean. Unfortunately, as is the way in Singapore, the additional prices were ridiculous! The mini-bar sported: Pepsi cans at $5 each, beer cans at $8 each and water at $2.50 each!!! There was no wifi in the rooms, and while they did offer a free LAN cable, I was too scared to check the price. This is not really an issue with the Royal at Queens in specific – rather with hotels in Singapore in general, and one that I will harp about until it is resolved. It is 2011 people! They offer free wifi at Changi airport! You charge a decent amount for your hotel and offer so little for it… So other than that little rant, there were just one other little issue. The bath/shower combination was great, but the shower curtain was too close to the wall and it was impossible to shower without wearing it. All in all, not a bad option for central Singapore. Unfortunately the Royal At Queens Hotel is just like most other hotels in Singapore, presuming that because you are prepared to spend decent money for the hotel they can charge you ridiculous amounts for everything else - $8 for a beer; that is criminal, from a hotel that charges over $150 AUD per night! I don’t expect it to change, but I don’t have to like it, and it’s a big part of why I only ever stop over in Singapore, rather than consider it a tourist destination in itself. So the Royal At Queens Hotel; decent, but no more.

Reviews.Title: “Just Nice.”
Reviews.Author: roycie83
Reviews.Content: Pros: - An MRT station is just right outside the hotel. - An extra $10, buffet breakfast and unlimited internet was provided. - Located close to the end of Orchard road & Little India. You could walk right to Orchard Road. Cons: - The lighting control panel by the bedside is brightly lit. Even at night, the panel is bright that it disturbs my sleep. A big con for those who have trouble falling asleep at night. - Charged $2.50 for small hotel brand bottle water. First hotel that charged for it. - A cockroach ran right on the table.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: cjacob28
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and 5 days in this apartment-hotel. My wife and I, plus 3 children (ages 21, 11 & 8) enjoyed the comforts of this apartment. Very cozy, near the metro (3 mins walk) and lots of restos within the vicinity. Iconic places such as Museums and Malls are within a 3 block radius. The staff are very warm and accommodating, check in and check out went smoothly. We were not specifically fond of the breakfast buffet - it lacked the variety required to be a buffet to begin with. The dining hall always overcrowded and the staff seem always running around in chaos. However this did not prevent us from having a really great time in Singapore. Good place to stay at - recommendable to families with children. 7 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation for Singapore Stopover Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Cindy N Z
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights as part of Singapore Stopover Holiday as a couple. Great location. Friendly service (especially from the doorman who makes you feel at home). Clean and very comfortable room. Wifi at reception with couch area for you to sit. Nice pool. Tiny gym. The best thing about this hotel was letting us check in early in the morning so we can have a shower before starting our sightseeing around Singapore. And after checkout that morning, they kept our luggage at reception all day and even allowed us to use their shower by the pool in the evening before we travelled to the airport at night.

Reviews.Title: “Location, the best factor for a Tourist”
Reviews.Author: Basu123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very very centrally, easily accessible through MRTS, Bus Taxi etc., close to all places of tourist interest and of course the hotel caters to leisure travellers and business traveller alike. The hotel has well appointed rooms with very nice furnishings and cost is not that great. Hotel provides brasserie for food for all kinds of taste, Wi-Fi connectivity, room service, health centre, swimming pool and parking facilities. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: AmitJ24
Reviews.Content: The one thing that makes this hotel stand apart from others is its location. It is quite centrally located and hence one can reach almost all of Sinagpore easily from this hotel. The hotel per se, was good. The reception area was quite small (smaller than most of the hotels I have been to), rooms were comfortably large (but I would have preferred somewhat larger rooms), cleanliness top notch, room service great. The staff speak is some sort of an accented English which does make communication somewhat tedious sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and great location”
Reviews.Author: Cybdiver1
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location they always say that and this hotel is right smack dab in the middle of everything. Okay nothing is really that far. I gave it 4 stars because the room was very clean. Over all it's a little old but it was clean and the staff is very nice. The lobby resturant is very Americanized. What do you do with a hotel room? sleep and get washed. The TV was an old Tube set surprisingly but how much TV do you really watch in a hotel room? Singapore has rain go buy an umbrella and get out. You are surrounded by plenty of activities. I've been at 5 star hotels, and thought less of them. This place was very good I was there for 3 weeks on business.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jidabhas
Reviews.Content: What we like the most about this hotel is location. MRT is just in front of hotel entrance. Or if you tired from all the walk, Taxi to nearby near attractions Arub streets, Orchard Rd or Suntec City would cost around 5-8 Sgd.. Hotel is right next to Singapore Art Museum and Bugis Junction, Raffle, chijmes are within a short walk. We stayed 3 nights in a one bedroom apartment, fully equipped with kitchenette and washing machine good if you traveling for weeks and need to do laundry. Breakfast is average not many selection but hot and re-filled. Overall, we were happy and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 2-3 nights stay”
Reviews.Author: angelfire901
Reviews.Content: On the over-all, this hotel is okay and I wouldn't mind staying here again. It's not grand so don't expect 5 star service nor quality but good enough for 2-3 days stay. Quick list of pros and cons: - good location. It is central in location so any place you want to visit will take about 10mins by cab (and some are walking distance), compared to staying at Orchard area which would take about 20mins) - the rooms are clean; not huge but spacious enough to be able to move around - the pool is not big but good enough for cooling off after sightseeing - the staff are welcoming, polite, and helpful - there is a 24 hr foodcourt and several cafes a few steps away. the money changer and 711 is within hotel vicinity (take the connecting passage inside the hotel going to Alsons) - taxis right infront of the hotel, and train station a few steps away so no need to worry about transportation - good building security as the key card is required for the lift and pool/gym area Cons: - small lobby that feels like a bus station with so much luggage around - there's variety for breakfast for both asians and westerners but i didnt like the food -- too bland - there's a gym but too few equipment. cramped too - the mineral water is not complimentary and no morning paper (which i think should be standard although the other hotels i've stayed at are more of the "premium" type so maybe that's the difference when you pay a higher price) If you want to be at the center with some peace and quiet at night, this is a good choice. But if your agenda is to shop til you drop, then stay at the Orchard area.

Reviews.Title: “happy with overall service”
Reviews.Author: pollyannapooledorset
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 26th Aug to 29th Aug, we arrived early in the morning and checkin was quick by 0915 we were in our room not many hotels would let you in your room before 1200. The lobby area is being renovated but a porter came out and brought our luggage into foyer. Yes as other people have reported tha shower curtain was a problem we did flood the bathroom a few times. The hotel is by the MRT station which is good for getting around On our last day we checked out at 1200 but were able to leave our cases in the foyer your cases are tied together and a ticket issued to reclaim them later you are allowed to use the showers in the swimming pool towels provided if needed to freshen up if leaving later on in the day The staff are polite and helpfull the only downside is the food in the resturant is cold we had a meal on the first night in the hotel food was nice but all of it was cold The hotel was in a good location and I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Tired and out of the way”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stopover on the way to Europe as part of Singapore Airlines package. The hotel was undergoing renovations which it desperately needs. The rooms aren't too bad but the foyer and pool area look tired. The staff were friendly and helpful but it isn't helped by the hotel being away from most of the tourist type restaurant areas although it is very close to Raffles Hotel. We spent a considerable time trying to find someone to eat on a Saturday night. Going anywhere means either a decent walk or a Metro ride. Overall we have stayed in better places in Singapore and if you get choice pick something closer to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate - but no more”
Reviews.Author: Angelrah79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of a Singapore Stopover Holiday, we certainly would not have paid the full tariff. Our room was perfectly comfortable and pleasant enough but the shower curtain is completely hopeless - you are either wrapped in it like a shroud or if you push it out of the way the whole bathroom gets flooded. I wouldn't eat in the restaurant, there are much cheaper options for eating nearby. Little India is a walkable distance, I would probably take a taxi if you want to go shopping at Mustafa's. The hotel is almost next door to a MRT station, and generally seemed well located.

Reviews.Title: “clap trap, dirty, old, stale and incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: TobySimkin
Reviews.Content: not a good experience... spent 2 weeks living here when on business, and had such a horrible time daily with the front desk, and concierge -- largely a nonchalant, lazy staff, with a few exceptions -- had one nice duty manager in the lobby, and 1 nice bellman who were helpful and apologizing for their co-workers. Rooms are reminiscent of holiday inn or quality inn's in the 1970's -- stale, musty, pokey -- places you would NEVER want to put an ultraviolet light in! Internet speeds are OK, but often broke down. Showers are old, toilets are older, amenities are cheapest of the cheap, and towels thin and small. LOCATION is good -- close to various restaurants, coffee, subway etc... Hotel is one the few that is smoking friendly. Bottom line, you get (almost) what you pay for -- cheap 3-4 star gets you cheaper 2-3 star service and quality. Since they claim they are 4 stars, I have to disagree, and only give them 3.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Adelaide Tripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family in two seperate rooms. If we had of known that there were renovations being done at the front entrance we would not have booked here. No doorman to help with our luggage which was heavy to carry up the steps and through the night club area. Staff were off hand except the concierge. They did not seem very friendly. Our rooms were quite comfortable though but the shower curtain thing was a nuisance. Pool was in poor condition tiles were cracked or missing causing our grandchildren to have scratches and scrapes. It looked nothing like the inviting photo on the internet. Buffet breakfast was expensive with not a great choice. Best part the chef cooking your choice of omelete. Drinks were over the top in price. A glass of wine for $16 is highway robbery. not enough seating in the lobby for people waiting to be picked up for their airport transfer and not allowed to sit in the night club unless you buy a drink. Internet access is expensive at $6 for one hour. Bugis market and Bras Basah close which was great. Definitely would not stay again. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Service”
Reviews.Author: fil-chi_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. It was a bad experience at the start. My boyfriend booked our stay at AirAsiaGo and when we got there the hotel didn't have our reservation...spent almost an hour waiting. Finally they agree to accommodate us and confirm with AirAsia on Monday but we had to deposit SGD50. We were in the 16th floor which is the top level. Power in the room was crappy. Lights keep going on and off. Had them fix it and it still didn't work out well after that...had to call them back again. They were suppose to change our room but they just let someone fix it..at least the poor was okay the last night. Buffet was good...coffee was good...just didn't like the bacon...bacon doesn't taste the way it did back home. Location is good near the Bras Basah Yellow Line. A walking distance to the Bugis Junction...you can walk there late at night if you want some McDonald. 2 7-11 on the street behind the hotel. 1st day for breakfast, we got to the buffet...gave our room number and for some reason it was already marked. Like someone was already there for our buffet. Wasn't happy with that. Hotel was at renovation so it kinda look crappy when you go in.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room I think.. 2nd time not so impressed ok for 1 night.”
Reviews.Author: vailskiier22
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit - this time room 930, decor was fine but definitely showing signs of use and abuse but everything in the room functions fine and seems clean but the walls and carpet have taken quite a lot of wear - not surprising really, but not as pleasant as my last room because of that alone. Air con is noisier than normal, but can turn it on and off easily. Quite room despite building works on the front lobby area. Receptionist/check in friendly. TIP for wireless: I am typing this from my bed as I picked up a wireless access ticket from "Information" at Singapore airport before catching my bus connection and it is working from this room - wohoo - (this free access is good for 4 hours after you get the slip). Overall I think I may look for an alternative for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about really, but not our taste.”
Reviews.Author: AusTryst
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week, the father-in-law chose the hotel. As other reviewers have said, it's close to the Bras station, also to the Bugis Street Markets, where you can find a few bargains, but don't expect name brands.. It's also walking distance to Little India and Mustafa's. Also as others have stated the shower curtain is a pain in the rear. The staff were very good, we often didn't put 'Make up our room' on our door til after 12 and it always was done by the time we returned. Gym is a treadmill, stepper and bike, that's it. The pool is a small lap pool, on the side of the hotel on 4th floor, doesn't get any afternoon sun, and there are only 4 sunbeds around it, so don't expect singapore slings by the poolside here. Found each level smelt a little of smoke. The breakfast is ok, bacon is overcooked, the highlight being the omelettes for mine, but there is plenty to choose from. So yeah, nothing to really complain about, they are doing some reno works out the front atm, but it's hardly an imposition, just means entering and exiting through the night club. Best thing they could do, is to give free wi-fi throughout the building, instead they just offer it in the foyer/Level 2, so you often have half a dozen people sitting in the foyer on the lounges and on the steps accessing the free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, You definitely get what you pay for but its Ok for the price.”
Reviews.Author: zedmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a free night stop over on the way to Europe. The stopover was paid for by Singapore Airlines and was rated in the middle of the range hotels that we considered, albeit that you really dont get much choice on a free stop over hotel. The hotel was not somewhere we would have booked had we been paying for it but it did the job as a base for a one night wirlwind stopover in Singapore with friends who had never been to Singapore before. The hotel is old and very tired, which is obvois from the minute you pull up. The lobby looks good on the internet but it was probably a stock photo from 20 years ago as the lobby is also very tired and dated compared to other Singapore hotels we have stayed in. The worst first impression of this place is the staff who gree you and check you in. I have never experienced such unattentive and gruff Sigapreans before. they really let the place down the most. The staff seem like there are always bickering with each other and all look far too stressed for a small hotel. The rooms are OK, yest the rooms are dated and an attempt has been made to freshen them up but it is just superficial but it does the job. The bathrooms are ok, reasonably clean and overall you could do a hell of a lot worse than this place. Im not sure of the price of a room but I would not pay more than a $140 a night for this room. Singapore is an expensive city for hotel rooms but I would not pay much more for this hotel. Our breakfast was not included but we had a look at the half price bufet breakfst and quickly decided to run for it as it looked VERY ordinary, we found a place around the corner which was expensive but didnt feel like it would kill us if we ate there. Overall, the location was OK, not where I would stay by coice but ist was close to Orchard Road and taxi's are so cheap it doesnt matter where you are really. As I said you could do alot worse than this place and it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSandgroper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 11 nights via the Singapore Stopover Holiday. If it wasn't for that, we wouldn't normally have stayed at this hotel due to the price. The check-in and check-out was very easy. They have seats at the front to allow for a comfortable check-in. The hotel is in a great location - only a few minutes to Bras Basah MRT station and about 10 minutes to Bugis Junction/Bugis MRT. Easy access to Bugis Junction was great, as it meant easy access to Starbucks, various eateries, the foodcourt and the supermarket (to top up on water and snacks). On the way to Bugis Junction, you can cut through the Church (as long as you're not too early or too late, otherwise the gates are still locked). The rooms were spacious enough. The bathroom had the typical hotel shower curtain that clings to you every time you have a shower, and doesn't do much to prevent water running along the bathroom floor. The only issue I had with my room was when the lights wouldn't turn off, so I just slept with the lights on. It was fixed after I told reception. A fellow traveller had to change rooms on the first night due to a water leak in the bathroom (water was leaking through the shower mirror on the wall and pooling on the floor (!!!???) and there were ants in the room. A few nights later, in the new room, they had ants crawling throughout the room (a call to reception pretty much fixed this). Staff were polite and helpful each time we had an issue. The hotel lobby does not have a public telephone but you can use the public phones across the road in the Oxford Hotel. The room had a flat screen TV, bar fridge, room safe and plenty of wardrobe space. As far as hotel rooms go, this hotel is okay; but I definitely wouldn't pay full price to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall-you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Zax168
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Excellent location 1 min walk to Bras Basah MRT. Tips buy an ez link card for travelling, use the lifts on concourse level for quick access to the platforms. Renovation works at the front so no luggage ramp up to foyer..no porters around so you may need to ask for help. Check in/out speedy. Gym consists of 3 pcs of equipment. Pool is very small but surprisingly actually ok. Breakfast is ok for the price not too much fighting for the food with others! Room was very clean and made up daily. The shower curtain problem is true! Tip, just run the water over the bottom of the curtain so it sticks to the bath and not you! Overall very good budget hotel..and you do get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: nzfox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way through to London and it was very adequate. We arranged the transfers to and from the airport through Singapore Airlines and that worked very well. The hotel staff were very helpful and assisted us as much as they could. When we arrived late on the way over to Europe, the room was all ready with the cot for our son all made up. The rooms are well appointed but the air-con was very cold and we couldn't seem to adjust it. The bed was great, room service was prompt and they helped us with all our luggage. The lcoation is absolutely perfect for walking to the river, shopping centres and buses / trains. I would stay here again so long as we get the same deal as the general pricing looked very high.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: wtcmor
Reviews.Content: Good location, budget hotel and very expensive for what you get. Room quite large however because you cannot turn air conditioning off - very noisy at night. Kept me awake for most of the night. Breakfast ok, only stay here if you get a good price

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Convinent Location”
Reviews.Author: parktravellers
Reviews.Content: Great for a nights stay over, close to Bras Bah MRT station and local shops. Staff are very effecient with there check in check out process. We stayed with our two boy's who enjoyed the pool and the buffet breakfast. We took the MRT to the airport on leaving and it was a easy trip from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: brownsugar18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights with a Singapore Stopover with our 15 month old son and mother in law (she was in her own room). After reading some previous reviews we were a bit concerned as to what the hotel would be like. We were pleasantly surprised - the check in staff were great and really helpful, the room was ready and was a good size. Very clean and not too used and abused. I did have a minor issue with the shower curtain which tended to be sucked into the shower and would stick to the body - not too cool when your trying to hold and shower your baby at the same time. The location was superb, close to some great shopping and food centres - as well as little india, Arab st and the marina area as well as Orchard st and the MRT is right next door. We did not have breakfast included but next door is a great little restaraunt which has yum breakys. The pool was fine - its perfect for laps or just a cool off in the hot afternoons. Overall there was nothing wrong with this hotel - its not 5 star but its super comfortable and perfect for discovering singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for Singapore, great location.”
Reviews.Author: foliumnondefluet
Reviews.Content: In a city with some of the most expensive hotels in Asia the Royal is good option as a convenient base for seeing Singapore. The hotel itself is ok in most respects, rooms, cleanliness, service, food, ambience. What makes it a viable choices it's location next door to Bras Basar MRT station and price. Focus on these and it is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing thrilling but standard hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Charl3s
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via the hotel website as they proposed a special deal with free internet and late checkout. Had to ask for the promised late check out twice before they granted it. The room was all in all ok although the bathroom was a bit dirty. The gym is a tiny room with a bycicle but the pool is of average size. The included breakfast was good for Asian standards. Would possibly stay here again if they offer inclusive deals via their homepage.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: sandy_feet80
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to all the scenic sites (perfect for photographers) and malls. Rooms are clean and tidy with free high speed internet! Exit the hotel and you will find that you are surrounded by food courts!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vikasaga
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel family hotel, very friendly staff, good food, peaceful location, centrally located, well connected. For Indian vegetarians there is not much choice, try to get hotel nr. Little India.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Vive77
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Check in was quick and everyone was attentive. We loved our room. It had such a warm cosy feel to it and was very comfortable. Room service was awesome. Breakfast and dinner was great, big selection to choose from. Hotel is in a great location. Easy access to most places. Good concierge. We will definitely come back to this hotel, whenin singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Hopeless”
Reviews.Author: tazze
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location, but there are plenty of others nearby. I didn't accept the first two rooms I was given as both had ants crawling all over and the first had very noisy A/C. The third was just about acceptable, but way below expectations for the price. All had connecting doors, which I was assured were well noise insulated, but on my second night I was disturbed continually by next door residents (only talking!). Room amenities (shampoo etc) were clearly the cheapest they could buy and the shower curtain had been badly located so that it made the space to shower about 300mm wide - so it kept sticking to me throughout. No free water bottles were provided, so it was either buy from the mini-bar or go out to a shop - unforgivable in a humid climate. Internet was not cheap and frankly was unusable - it took me 10 mins+ to check in online! At least they credited this on my bill. In summary, this hotel is obviously being operated to a tight budget with corners cut all over the place despite a non-budget price. Staff were reasonably helpful, but it was an uphill battle for them to overcome the shortcomings of the hotel itself. I seldom fe lthe need to fill in comment cards, but this time I filled it up!

Reviews.Title: “good breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: agm72
Reviews.Content: Hotel Royal @ queens is very near to the restaurants, shopping mall, train stations, bus stops and if you are a Roman Catholic, the church is just across the hotel. Their staff are courteous and ready to help. Checking in and out is a breeze. cleanliness is okay, beds and pillows are comfy, water pressure is great, with free tea and coffee making facilities (replenish everyday).Buffet breakfast have wide selection and good but expensive when not included in your package.Overall stay at this hotel is a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience. Avoid”
Reviews.Author: GudduKolkata
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Queens hotel a week back. We booked this hotel only cos of the excellent experience last year. Bu it seems everything has changed in a year. Positives : 1) Wonderful location. Close to everything. Sometimes the only reason to stay here 2) Quality of room is not bad. Nice touch controls 3) Can get this hotel really cheap (Dont book on the hotel website, will get 20-40% cheaper on agoda, dizzy goat etc or best search on wego.com) Negatives : 1) Terrible check-in procedure. Most of the ppl at the front desk look drained out at most times. They rarely smile and are just not interested 2) As we checked in around 11 AM we were told the room is not available (which is ok as the check in time was 2 PM) but the lady (and Mr.MANI) also said there was no double room until next day. Thats ridiculous. And believe me she did not care. 3) The hotel staff treat you as if they have obliged you by giving you a room. And because they know its cheap they treat you accordingly 4) There was no one at the entry gates to welcome the guests. No one to call the taxi. No one to help with luggage. Its like a really low cost airline service 5) After a long day at the universal studious we came back in the evening at 6 PM to see that the room was not cleaned. The house keeping said (Lady named Grace) she was busy with the check-out rooms. Lost it there. 6) The lobby itself looked like a storage place. Luggage everywhere. 7) No food options. Tough for vegetrarians Simply avoid this place unless we wish to overlook everythign cos of the location. Also, dont go by the positive reviews recently. They are incorrect. Everything at the hotel is deteriorating ! Regards, Gautam

Reviews.Title: “well situated”
Reviews.Author: taratat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights and had no complaints. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Close to hawker food markets and MRT. Easy walking distance to shopping malls and Orchard Road. Will stay here again when we visit Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: JetVortex
Reviews.Content: The stopover hotel - 3 nights, 2 rooms. This time interconnecting. I would say this is a solid 3.5 Star Hotel, not quite 4 Stars. Picked up a great rate on Agoda including breakfast. We arrived in from Munich at 7.00am in the morning, we had 2 rooms booked, even though check in was at 2.00pm, they gave us 1 room straight away (thanks Ramon), and only had to wait until 10.30am for the 2nd room. My wife and kids had a chance to catch up on some sleep after a 12hour flight. Internet charges are reasonable, but the service is not wireless in the rooms, you need to borrow a cable from reception. The room rate included breakfast, honestly, is was an ordinary breakfast, but in saying that, we found plenty to eat and drink, it was included in the rate so we did not go anywhere else to eat for breakfast. The overall service of the hotel is good, rooms are smallish, but they worked for us, beds and pillows are comfortable. Rooms and bathroom were very clean. We had rooms on the 15th floor with a good view. Pool is a lap pool, so a little small, but everytime we went down we had it to ourselves so we were happy just to be in a pool to escape the heat. Close to the SMRT station, 5min walk to Bugis Street. Need to check in for our flight home, staff allowed me to print the boarding passes in the Business Centre for no charge. We organised a late check out for our evening flight, it was a reasonable SGD$100++. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: rognrikki
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Royal is pretty good value for a hotel in this part of Singapore. The Location is very good, only metres from the MRT station and an easy walk (even in Singapore humidity) to Chijmes, Raffles and the city Malls. A few good hawker centres for food around, I would recommend the one round the corner in Victoria st. The rooms like like they have been done up fairly recently, with good beds, tvs and furniture. The staff were helpful and allowed use to check in early. The downsides probably relate to the shower in the bath with shower curtain, they should have removed these during the renovations, the swimming pool is only small and in an odd location (although its good enough to cool off on a singapore afternoon), and the buffet breakfast is fairly basic, if its not included in the price of the room don't bother paying extra for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good position for everything”
Reviews.Author: LancashireFemale
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice & found this hotel very convenient for getting around sightseeing. Our rooms were very nice although we hated the shower curtain, it kept sticking to us, screens are much better! We did not eat in so cannot comment about the food. The porters were efficient in looking after our bags both times whilst we were out & about before our onwards flights..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.. service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Charmed224
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 50 meters from Bras Basah train station. The hotel needs to improve their check-in procedure and have to be attentive to the needs of its customers. For example, they did not tell us that the internet cable will have to be asked from the concierge not from housekeeping. Hotel was renovated what you see in their pictures is the actual room view.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable tour”
Reviews.Author: Kamlesh0143
Reviews.Content: I booked my holidays through Equino tours & travels. It was worth staying with Hotel Royal Queens for its hospitality as well as it very assesable to rome over singapore city as the location of the hotel was very perfect. Food was very taste and hygenic. Services were upto the mark. We had an splended experience with singapore tour. Hotel Royal Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: boxfish70
Reviews.Content: For a stopover (one night) we stayed at the royal @queens hotel. The location is good, also the room, but the breaktfast buffet was rather poor. For one night, it was all together ok. Tiny pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and location”
Reviews.Author: AnuBho
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel twice (once in May 2009 and then again in May 2010) with different groups of people and we have all enjoyed both the times that we have been there. The Rooms are spacious and the staff helped us accomodate the children by putting in extra beds and towels etc. The Food was amazing. Their breakfast spread included Chinese, malaysian, American and Indian food. Singapore truly being the melting pot of cultures, it was well-reflected in their food style. The hotel helps you in planning your city tour and also trips to Sentosa Island and other places of attraction. The staff speaks in a variety of languages (English, Chinese, Malaysian etc) The hallways are very clean and neat. There are shops inside the hotel lobby along with restaurants, a very cute swimming pool and a very well equipped gym. It also has party halls, conference and meeting rooms. The Hotel also has entrances from two sides. So the one-way road system does not actually affect your cab bill , since you can get down on either side of the hotel and walk right through ! The hotel is very well connected to nearby malls and has a lot of galleries near by. The Bugis junction mall, also has a street shopping right across the road. Ideal for tourists. The Staff also helps in identifying the closest metro stations and the system for first-timers. Worth every penny spent !

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pradipcs63
Reviews.Content: rooms are clean and roomy good location from mall and shopping complex. not very far form MRT nearby budget restraurants are there good staff good sea food available internet availablity at price you may like to stay in your next visit

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: catchme79
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a Singapore Air Stopover package and we weren't dissappointed. I was travelling with my elderly disabled step dad and it was great for a 36 hour stay. Lovely location right next to the underground and main road. The taxis are very cheap and there are 100's of them so you don't have a long wait. It was about £15 to go to the zoo from the hotel and about a 25 minute taxi ride. That was a good rate if you compare it to getting the bus which takes about an hour and charges £20 each and leaves at the crack of dawn! The rooms were beautiful and clean. Lovely air conditioning, TV, DVD player and the lights were all computer controlled! I managed to crash the light system by pressing too many buttons at once but a quick call to reception had the problem fixed. There wasn't much noise from outside as we were on the 10th floor if I remember and if you are jet lagged you don't have problems getting to sleep. The restaurant was nice as it saved us having to go and find somewhere in the dark. My step dad enjoyed it as they did fish and chips and a cup of tea!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special and expensive”
Reviews.Author: psinner
Reviews.Content: Nothing really bad about this place but nothing particularly good either. Didn't sleep well partly due to noisy extractor which you can't turn off. Fitness centre was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel with a strategic location”
Reviews.Author: WorldGlutton
Reviews.Content: On a last minute arrangement we booked this hotel through a friend , we find that it is convenient to all shopping and especially there is a MRT station nearby. Hotel is very clean and the bed is comfortable. We were in a hurry and on short stay, didnt take any pictures, but will certainly come back again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cold water, ants, slow internet and noisy AC”
Reviews.Author: toby1kenoby
Reviews.Content: I have spent 3 weeks in this hotel due to work. If I had paid width my own money, I would not saty in this hotel. The bed is ok, but the odd ant comes crawling by ever so often. God fobid that you leave something sweet out, then there is ants all over it. I see some reviews in here that the internet is quick, but thats definitky not the case. You will not be able to see youtube videos, or stream TV from home in this hotel. the internett is OK at best, but the days when the hotel is full up, you might as well give up and go somwhere else. I have had roomservice a few times. The first one took close to two hours before it arrived, the others was alot quicker. The food is good, but the selection on the roomservice menu is very limited. They also close the roomservice around 2130 or thereabouts, so no 24/7 service here. The gym is what I would call a micro gym width a crosstrainer, a bike and a treadmill... this is allready to much equipment in the room. The parking is free in the hotel, so thats a good bonus for me.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel on a good location”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights - staff were friendly and helpful - the room was modern, spacious and well furnished - we had a good size LCD TV and DVD Player. The bed was comfortable. The hotel is about a 3 min walk to the Bras Basah MRT station and 5 minutes walk from Bugis Junction. It is in a quiet street and the breakfast is quite ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with amazing location”
Reviews.Author: neham100
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 rooms for 3 nights for our trip to Singapore with my parents from 26th feb to 1 march 2011. I had booked the hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor We really enjoyed our stay at the royal at queens. It has an amazing location surrounded by the beautiful architecture of Singapore. The rooms were plush,comfortable and cozy and gave a great view of the city from the 16th floor.The bathrooms are nicely designed and even had a weighing scale-helpful in weighing luggage. The breakfast menu was also good with at least 1-2 options for an Indian vegetarian. vicinity to Little India by cab (around 5 S$) was an added advantage to go for dinner where vegetarian restaurants were abundant viz sarvana bhavan, anand bhavan, hot chips etc. MRT stations were also at walking distance, though did not use it as traveled by cabs. The only markdown was that there was no free internet, wifi area. Also the staff though good and helpful ,could have been more friendly as was awed with warm and pleasant welcome at Changi airport. The best airport seen till date. overall it was a pleasant stay at the hotel and would recommend it to others to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer88
Reviews.Content: I couldn't get the hotel I wanted for my trip to Singapore and settled to stay at Hotel Royal at Queens Road. What I liked about the hotel: The Bras Basah MRT station is right next door. What I disliked about the hotel: Hotel didn't have a concierge to handle any of my queries, the hotel had the thinnest pillow which felt like I wasn't sleeping on any pillow, the shower curtain was fixed too far in as a result one have handly any room to stand when taking a shower and lastly, the coffee house waiter/waitresses went to take a break at the same when I went to have coffee at about 4 pm. I waited for some time for anyone to take my order. They apologised and said they were all taking a break. Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is Great”
Reviews.Author: PatCastro
Reviews.Content: The room is nice, the staff are accommodating and location is very accessible, near in train station. Bugis Market is near and at the back of hotel there is food court, church is near... We recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “nice room, average breakfast, small shower, potential issues for gay travellers”
Reviews.Author: AUandUKcitizen
Reviews.Content: The main negative of this hotel for us was the attitude of the man who checked us in - he appeared to be a manager who was training a younger female staff member. I quite clearly booked 2 x queen rooms, one for myself and my partner and one for my partner's mother. The man decided that since we were two females he would give us a room with 2 single beds, even though I confirmed the fact that both rooms should have a queen bed. In fact I could see that the girl understood and put us in the double room and my partner's mother in the room with the single beds but the manager swapped them back around - I am sure that this was homophobia and not a mis-understanding. So, once we got up to the rooms we realised and just swapped over, but it was an annoying start to the stay. The other negative was the crappy wifi - only available in the reception/breakfast area and required a log in from the reception desk. Wifi didn't always work and the log in info from reception sometimes didn't work because it had already been used by someone else or was out of date ... and if the wifi dropped out it logged you off and yet another log in was needed to get back on. All in all, very annoying and we largely gave up. The rooms were comfortable except for the small shower with a shower curtain that stuck to you, breakfast was OK - probably appropriate for the price of the room. The hotel is in a good location, so I will look for other options in this area when I come back to Singapore - but I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nanz75
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for around three nights last summer. The hotel is in great locations, with nearby malls and restaurants. Singapore Art Museum as well as the Bras Basah MRT station are just a few steps away. Breakfast is okay, not that great but not lousy either. The dining area is always full but not that crowded. You can also just walk to Chimes, a really cool hang out place. The room we stayed in was quite clean and spacious too. Staff is courteous and accommodating. Really comfortable place to stay when touring SG.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: tal63goldCoast
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my 2 teenage children. We booked a 1 bedroom apartment which had 1 king size bed and bathroom in 1 room and 1 sofa bed and a small kitchen with a washer/dryer in the other room. The sofa bed was very uncomfortable for my 18 yr old son and would have been better having a single bed instead. The king size bed was very comfortable, the bathroom had been recently renovated and we had a large flat screen t.v. The touch controls were a nice touch however we needed 2 cards to access electricity in the 2 rooms of our small apartment. The breakfast buffet had a good selection and was very busy every morning we were there. We liked the location, Bras Basah MRT at end of our street which we used to travel to Singapore Zoo- a must see when in Singapore. We used the Hop on hop off bus to get around the city at $12.00 singapore per day. We enjoyed the hawker stall in the next street, great food and close by to Bugis markets. The reception staff were very unprofessional and gave out incorrect information. I requested to book the Airport bus to pick us up at our hotel to go to the airport early in the mornin g at 5.00am. I was told that hotel staff can only book 3 hours prior. I requested that they do that. They informed me I needed to phone the front desk at 2.00am to get them to book it, which I did even though it seemed an odd practice. When I set the alarm and phoned front desk at 2.00am to make my booking, I was told sorry the bus doesn't start pick ups until 7.00am , you'll need to book a taxi,. Absolutely unbelievable example of poor customer service. By the way I paid $960 Singapore plus 17% taxes for 3 nights at this place which ewas very expensive even by Singapore standards. I will never stay here again due to the carefree attitude and total lack of respe ct by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Only stayed for a night, but enjoyed every single minute”
Reviews.Author: Peken1na
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great location. Very central; - Modern clean rooms, toilet facilities - hairdryer as well; - Touchpad functions: light switches - Very large and comfy bed; - Very nice staff. The receptionist was very nice and made sure I was pleased with the room I was given. Cons: - The hotel was crowded and the staff couldn't handle it. I had to clear a table for myself and the tables are for 4, at least. So you have to have breakfast next to the other guests. Not very nice. I only stayed for a night so I can't help much more than this...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service and room upkeep”
Reviews.Author: Kumarnat
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is ideal as malls and eating outlets are close by, it is in a bylane so noise levels are also pretty low. The rooms are very small, and almost all the rooms occupied by our group noted that the bathroom doors were not getting locked. We had specifically requested for rooms with queensize beds and an extra bed given the family unit of 2 adults and 2 children, the hotel in its own wisdom gave as two rooms each family with seperate twin beds with the excuse that extra beds were not available, where is the sense then in taking bookings well in advance. Further, the rooms were allocated across the hotel for the six families. The lift only works with the room access cards and you are expected to ask for the additional access card from the reception, they do not advise you or give you the extra card given that they are aware of the way their lifts work. The room itself is well maintained and has a good system of one single controller near the bed to control all the lights and a separate alarm clock for the occupants. The bell-boys and service personnel were most helpful in sharing information, the hotel also has a tour desk which is most helpful. The hotel swimming pool is rather dissapointing and did not see any activity out there for the period of stay. The breakfast has a good spread for all and is usually part of the package for Lunch and dinner there are several option which are much cheaper close to the hotel. The hotel is close to the MRT station, but a bit away from the Hop on bus stop, which is more helpful for tourists. Overall though not very positive neither anything to be negative about the Hotel, hence would say Nuetral.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TrickyTK
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to find suitable family accommodation in Singapore. This was good because it had interconnecting rooms and was very close to a MRT station. Rooms were small and the water took a long time to drain in the bathroom. Choice of tv was good. Breakfast was crowded but a good selection was provided. It was convenient to shops and other points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, having booked through agoda. The rooms were spacious, by Singapore standards. The hotel is very close to new and underutilised Circle Line. However to get to the city or Orchard Road, you will need to make a change at the next station. Breakfast was not included so when told it was $S25, opted to go outside. If you can wait till 8.30am, Dome, just down the street, has excellent coffee and a good breakfast. Otherwise you can walk a bit further to the 24hour Kopitiam for local breakfast. Keep your handbag on your person at all times though - I have had a bag stolen from under my chair at Bras Basah Kopitiam. Hotel was good value and convenient. Not five-star, about 3 star. I would stay there again. The hotel is very

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value - shabby outside but renovated and spotless room”
Reviews.Author: Viper73
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 night in an "apartment" room in Dec 10 (1 double room + 1 kitchen and living with convertible couch). The building outside is shabby but is completely renovated inside. Common spaces are decorated to the taste of mainland Chinese tourists, but the room was recently renovated, with a nice comfy bed, big plasma TVs, kettle, fridge, spotless clean bathroom with excellent shower, decorated with subtlety. The hotel is excellently located, a stone's throw from Esplanade MRT, buses going everywhere, walking distance to Chijmes, Raffles Hotel, Fort Canning, and City Hall, and to Clarke Quay and Arab Street in 20 mins walk. Amenities are minimal: very small pool, bar and restaurant area, but there is no reason to dine in with so many better options around. Unfortunately, wifi is only available in the hall, while wired internet is available in the room (both complimentary). Overall, good value for Singapore prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfy Room - just a couple of things.....”
Reviews.Author: GBtraveller78
Reviews.Content: Hotel Royal at Queens is in a great spot, near Raffles, Orchid Rd and a host of interesting Landmarks/shops/markets. The exterior and reception area are a little drab and the restaurant and bar don't look very enticing - but the actual rooms are very nice. As far as customer service is concerned, the Porters, Duty Manager/s and Door Men are all very friendly. An unfortunate exception to this, however, are the young girls who work at the front desks. They are rude and abrupt and seem disinterested in helping guests. Of note was the difficulty I experienced connecting to Wi Fi broadband in the lobby (which you need to pay for). They kept providing me with passwords, none of which worked to enable me to connect. I was trying to explain the importance of the matter as I needed to confirm a flight...and they just kep[t handing out more bogus passwords. I eventually saw the Duty Manager and explained the situation and his service was fantastic. I think Hotel Royal at Queens is good value and I would stay there again, but I just hope the girls at the front desk learn to become just a little more helpful....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: AditiNathani
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the hotel are new and very welcoming, the bathrooms were very nicely designed also. The breakfast was good. Ample choice for all taste buds. The location of the hotel is nice as it very close to the Bras Basah MRT station and City Hall. Double bed rooms are limited so please let the reception know about your preference of the type of room you want. Overall it was a pleasant experience at Royal @ Queens.

Reviews.Title: “Nice "in the city" Stay”
Reviews.Author: arun1111
Reviews.Content: Very great location for shopping loving persons. Vicinity to Mustafa Market, food markets, restaurants serving Indian food specifically is added advantage. local conveyance for nearby locations is also available conveniently. Nice to stay with family.

Reviews.Title: “Central, value for money and clean”
Reviews.Author: casspb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a package with the F! Grand prix. Very central with easy walking distance to the track, clean, helpful staff. This hotel should really value their breakfast chef. She was able to remember how I like my eggs every day. A real treasure and they should hang on to her. For cheap meals there is a food court on both streets running parallel with Queen. Only downside is the bar which I assumed was part of the hotel. (it's not - had it been they would of had lots of patronage from us). I went in to sit and have a quiet drink, finally got served by a very rude and unfriendly girl. Asked how I would pay and I thought to charge to room, told no and give me your credit card now.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: paribrahmak
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel by all means. we were staying at the topmost floor so the view was amazing. lots of shopping places were at walking distance. the staff was helpful, i would not say amazing but decent and courteous. the room was not too big but comfy. the bed was such that you fall asleep as soon as you hit it. the breakfast buffet was good, had good menu but was same everyday. no change whatsoever, in all 3 days that we stayed for. but does not have free internet, thats bad.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Queenbee008
Reviews.Content: Everything was great Thomas was very helpful the doorman,everytime we came back into our room there was new coffee and tea, turning the lights on and off was pretty cool with a touch screen system, the hotel was kept very clean and it was a walk away from the train station and raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: HardingsBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We were on a Singapore stopover so the discounted price that we paid included transportation to and from the airport, discounted tours and 50% off meals in the hotel. Location was great - short walk to the new Bras Basha MRT station. Close to Raffles. The staff, at all times, were excellent and very accommodating. We were in Room 625. King size bed was comfortable. Great having kettle & fridge. In the 5 days we were there we lost power 3 times. Admittedly staff responded promptly, rectified the situation and apologised stating it is a computer problem that is listed to be fixed. The bath with overhead shower was exceptionally narrow and as a result we leaked water all over the floor every time we showered. A couple of times the maid neglected to empty a bin (but I had moved it from its normal position) and failed to change a glass - but they are minor problems. Was great having a large window with a view to the Singapore Flyer. Great stopover hotel but I would not have wanted to be paying the full price - but then again Singapore is not cheap. The tour company was very efficient, friendly and helpful. Food in restaurant was average but they are in the process of redoing the 2 restaurants on the 2nd floor. We were very happy and comfortable in the hotel. We were close enough to the other attractions and we moved about by MRT or even cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky it was free”
Reviews.Author: tys0n
Reviews.Content: We booked a Romantic Rhine cruise with Avalon Waterways and they included a stop over in Singapore at this hotel as part of the deal at no extra cost. If this had not been the case I would have stayed in Clarke Quay. After reading some of the reviews we were not expecting the world but I am surprised that a company like Avalon would put their clients up in this quality hotel. The reception area is so small you have to squeeze past a teller desk to get into the breakfast area when there is a customer sitting there. Then there is the food. Iv'e eaten better food at a cafeteria on a motorway. Then there is the plastic cutlery and glasses, help your self to tea and coffee, thats when there is any available. The tables were not cleared away quickly and you have to move dirty dishes your self. Our room was very small and the lighting would not turn on or off and had to be restarted due to an electronic problem. I would not stay at this hotel again even if it was free

Reviews.Title: “Geat Location and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DanilleT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Royal @ Queens for 5 nights at the end of a 3 week holiday with 5 other adults and a 6 month old. The hotel staff were excellent and were always there to help. They even knew where to buy baby formula when I ran out of the stuff. Rooms are a good size and clean. Bathrooms could do with a little seal around the bath area but other than that no complaints.
