Do not drink in the bar at the hotel (Queens Bar). Cost S$40 for 2 glasses of beer. Go to the local 7 Eleven and pay S$3 for a can of beer. Buffet breakfast was tasty. Location is central to pretty much everything and clost to the Bugis underground, but you can't pass up the taxis. Taxi drivers know where they are going in Singapore and offer a great deal of advice to the tourists. Will definately book the Hotel Royal again for my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, with "room" for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Yikesbikes
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hotel is great, almost bang where you would want it to be, not far from the City center and other locations and not on the mail road too. The hotel is in a lane off the main road, so it is quite a peaceful environment. The staff lacked english language skills (or a modicum of understanding), but if you were able to explain your need to them, they were quire helpful. Explaining to them was the hard part though. The rooms and the bathrooms were a tad too small. Windows were small enough not to allow sufficient sunlight in. However cleanliness of the hotel cannot be faulted. The restaurant was decent, not a great one and not any great variety of food either. Avoiding this is the best option. A decent gym, please donot expect the works. Overall, a nice place to stay, if you intend to stay out of the hotel for most fo the day and use it only as a base camp.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable base for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: coyotes_uk
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Hotel Royal @ Queens for a business trip to Singapore. In summary, if you are after a relatively cheap and comfortable base for exploring Singapore, you cant go wrong with the Royal @ Queens. The hotel is located a mere 20mins from Changi Airport close to the Singapore River. One block from Chijmes and right next to the Bras Basah CC2 subway station. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable, the lobby housing the check-in desks, restaurant and bar. The first floor's house the hotels own leisure centre and pool. I stayed on the top (16th) floor of the hotel, which is designated as a smoking floor. As a non-smoker I could not tell my room was a smoking room. The room's are big, clean and have wonderfully comfortable bed's! A large flat screen TV is stood opposite the beds, along side a usable work area and cupboards. The bathroom is bright and very smartly finished. Including a good size bath and very nice shower. Buffet Breakfast operates much like buffet breakfasts around the world, freshly cooked food and a separate omelette and egg counter. The only negative I had with the hotel, was really with the room electrics. It was very easy to short the electricity in the plug sockets. A number of times I would insert the room card to switch everything on, and would find none of the plug sockets worked. However on every occasion, a quick call to reception resolved each problem within 10 minutes. Not a flashy hotel, but a comfortable hotel with great service, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A good and neat place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnandG
Reviews.Content: Neat and Clean... comfortable, hygenic place to stay

Reviews.Title: “A place i would recommend all my friends to stay when they visit Singapore”
Reviews.Author: smahajan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located very close for shopping .The staff is very polite.Room service is very prompt.The breakfast is excellent with a wide variety of food. The rooms are clean and have a good view. A remarcable service we visited the hotel 3 times in the last 8 months as our son is studying in NUS .we arrived at 8.30 am ,we were given the rooms immediately on arrival though the check in is at 12.00 noon.during our 3 visits This happens very rarely at other Hotels I am sure they will continue to give the above services in future

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay overall”
Reviews.Author: neil4ever22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from the last week of May till the 1st week of June. Much better than what was expected. Bras Basah MRT is just 2 minutes away from the hotel and there is also a bus stop in close proximity. Bugis Street is around 10 min walk, which is really good for shopping. The breakfast at the hotel is good. The room is clean and has most of the required facilities when one travels with a family and children. The staff are pleasant and are always helpful. There is also a 24 hours food court and 7-11 around the corner (5 min walk). Would love to stay at the hotel again. We booked 3 rooms, and reached the hotel around 11.00. The check-in is normally around 3. The staff did still give us one room at 11.00 to chill out. The same at check-out when they allowed us to keep the room till 3 pm.. Overall

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel for Raffles stay”
Reviews.Author: Bombayindian
Reviews.Content: If you dont want to stay near Orchard, then this hotel is a good bargain. Great rooms, good pool, very decent breakfast buffet and walking distance from Raffles. Though not convenient to go to Orchard road. Also no good dining options nearby. More Suitable for business travel/layover than Leisure

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: leannematt22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel as part of the Singapore Stopover promotion. First night cost us $1 and second night was $89. Brilliant 3 star hotel only a 5 minute walk to Raffles and 10 minutes to Suntec City. New MRT Station being built just up the road making the whole city even more accesible to tourists. Bugis Street market was only 5 minutes walk from the hotel also. Very friendly and well mannered staff greeted us on our arrival and gave us all the information we needed during our stay. I would reccomend making your own way around the city rather than wasting money on the tourist buses. The MRT Stations are amazingly simple to locate and very easy to use, everything is basically spelt out for you as to where to get off and on, and we found it to be a great experience finding our own way around as well as saving $. If I had one negative thing to say about the hotel it would be that they advertise a gym when in reality it is a treadmill and crosstrainer in a small room near the swimming pool, so if that is the worse thing I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room”
Reviews.Author: kkdoo
Reviews.Content: Location is nice, close to Chijmes and Raffles Shopping Arcade. Poor breakfast buffet menu, no change of menu for 3 consecutive days.

Reviews.Title: “great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: pm123
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel Royal @ Queens for 3 nights. Very convenient location 2 mins walking distance to MRT and shopping district. great selection of restaurants in the vicinity. Hotel has a decent bar and coffee shop. ideal for business travellers. rooms are cozy, little small, bathroom is basic and clean. thay have wired internet in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable room, quiet & good location”
Reviews.Author: MaleeQT
Reviews.Content: My two teenage children and I were happy that we stayed in Hotel Royal at Queens for our 4-day holiday in Singapore. The room was clean and good-smelling (thankfully no awful-smelling carpet), and felt inviting after a long day of sight-seeing and shopping. It was also strategically located, i.e., within comfortable walking distance to museums, shopping & eating places, and other attractions. I liked it that it was in a quiet part of the city, away from the noise and crowd. The breakfast spread was suprisingly generous. Staff were helpful and friendly. Highly recommended for those looking for a budget no-frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilrc1
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality hotel, good quality beds and bedding, great views from 14th floor, very knowledgeable porters and reception staff, definitely recommend! Tip: Get a room on a high floor, the views are amazing, also if you have the green glass sink bowl, turn the tap on slow or you will be covered in water.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN & COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: vespa2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 10yo & 13yo on a $1 singapore stopover for 1 night. It was clean and comfortable. The location was good for us. The staff were friendly and polite. We requested two interconnecting rooms but were given two rooms next to each other (no intenal door between them) but for $1 each it was a bargin. The pool is small. No complaints. Would rate this a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: yippekaya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 hours as part of a Singapore Airlines Stopover deal. Was upgraded to a service apartment. The room had 2 separate entry doors and had 2 37" LCD TVs, plus cooker, microwave, washing machine, dining table & chairs and a safe. Everything seems a bit dated, but it is perfectly adequate for a stopover. I don't know what the standard rooms are like, since I was upgraded. As i was only staying here for one night, I did not even venture outside, so can't comment on the area the hotel is in.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern and central hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoMapNoWorries
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a trip with 9 family members as part of the $1 Singapore Airlines stopover deal. The hotel is very centrally located and walking distance to most of the city centre sights and shopping centres. It is off on a bit of a side street, so it is pretty quiet. The front reception isn't much to look at. We had some confusion checking in at the hotel because we had only recieved our hotel vouchers the day before - staff weren't too helpful and the two women at reception were not very friendly. I had a twin room on the 7th floor. The room was a little small for the two of us - while we got around comfortably enough, there isn't much space if two people have medium to large suitcases. The decor was suprisingly modern and the room was clean. The king single beds were extremely comfortable, as was the doona and pillows. The beds were the best thing about my stay - I had an amazing night's sleep. The bathroom was pretty spacious. There was a shower over bath with a thin plastic shower curtain. Because the bath itself is narrow and the curtain rail is too close to the shower, the plastic curtain kept sticking to me while in the shower. The shower pressure and temperature was good and constant. The room was extremely quiet - no traffic or no noise from others in the hotel. We arranged a wake up call for the next morning and this was done on time. We checked out smoothly. The hotel has a tiny gym with a treadmill, cross trainer and upright bike. They are all squeezed into a tiny room, so it's not particularly safe if there's more than one person in there. I didn't see the pool area, but there is a 25m lap pool also on the same floor. All in all, I had a good stay here and would reccomend it based on my very short stay. I'm not sure how much it costs normally, but for the $1 deal we got, it was an absolute steal. The comfortable beds were the best part about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a quick visit.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we got this hotel at a bargain price as part of a Singaopre Airlines stopover (we were only there 1 night). For the price, it was excellent value but not sure that we'd have paid the full rate. Definitely only a 3 star hotel - rooms were fine & bathrooms were good but public areas are not great & the restauarant was pretty bad - the buffet looked dried up & the a la carte wasn't much better. One of the waiters managed to spill a whole jug of iced water over me at lunchtime (it was really funny so I couldn't get cross) but they had nothing to dry me off only a couple of paper towels so I sat soaking for over an hour & at the end of the meal, we got the bill for the full ammount - including the drink! Still a good deal though but for longer we would definitely stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SnorkelingJeff
Reviews.Content: We picked up a fantastic internet deal from Singapore Airlines for the night we were obligated to spend in transit from Bali back to Estados Unidos. We were offered Royal@Queens for 1 USD each! Reviews from this site suggested that the rooms might me outdated and malodorous. If this was ever true (and I think some people are so sensitive that they should be forbidden to travel) it is certainly not the case today. We were greeted promptly and courteously, no problem about our ridiculously low rate, and given the key to a spacious room on an upper floor. Everything was spotless, remarkably modern and a delight to the olfactory. It might have been the nicest big city hotel room I have ever enjoyed! And not only that, but this hotel is in the thick of interesting cultural sights and shopping. The nearby Hindu temple was holding an afternoon service featuring a fellow playing a wind instrument usually associated with charming cobras. The temples and a great variety of malls and food courts were within a three block radius. We think Royal @Queens would have been worth several times what we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay - especially to art lovers and those who are interested in cultures”
Reviews.Author: Michelle5677
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum for a short vacation to Singapore. Location: This hotel is just 10 steps away from Singapore Art Museum - this is a lovely surprise as we booked this hotel through our Singaporean friends. As both of us love arts and also to see culturous stuff, our friends had chosen this hotel for us and I think they made a good choice. Besides the Art Museum, which is only short walking distance (it is just right at the side of the hotel), a building mostly occupied by book shops (百胜楼 in Chinese) is just at the back of this hotel - you may pass through the back door which linked to another hotel at its back. From this hotel, we walked to Clarke Quay which took us around 20 mins. It is easy as we don't have to make so many turns - just go out from its back door and turn to the right and go straight. On our way to Clarke Quay, we passed by many historical buildings/sites of Singapore. I also walked alone from Chinatown to this hotel. It took me around 35 mins to do so. By the way, there is one MRT station (under construction) right in front of this hotel. Besides, Many museums are just walking distant around this hotel. Hotel Room: Clean. with a big and wide LCD TV and lots of channels to choose from! I like the toilet. It is clean and the design is good. Buffet Breakfast is included. The taste of the food are ok. Their staff speaks good english and mandarin. Check in and check out were done quite fast. Only one thing, they have false alarm on the 1st night of our stay, but when we called reception, they immediately apologised.

Reviews.Title: “good location, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2x4
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 children stayed here for 6 nights. We were only allowed a King size bed and a 1 rollaway. It made the room very squeasy. The beds only had a thick quilt no top sheets, so we asked for a sheet, as the quilt was to hot, we had to pay $100 deposit!! They told us we could leave the sheet in the room at the end of our stay, but we took it to reception to get our money back. We liked the position of the hotel, a cheap taxi ride to Orchard Rd, close to a 7/11, and lovely cool shopping centre turning right out of hotel and walking 1 block. The breakfast was ok, the dinner was just ok but for S$12 what so you expect? We were the only ones in the restaurant, so had the whole buffet to ourselves! The pool would have to be the smallest hotel pool I have ever seen, but each time we went to the pool we were the only ones there! Close to Bugis station, could easily catch the MRT from airport to hotel and a short walk to the Allson hotel up to the second floor which joins to the Royal, easy!

Reviews.Title: “A place I grew to like very much”
Reviews.Author: handfordr
Reviews.Content: Stayed two separate nights either way on the Singapore Stopover scheme on trip to New Zealand so only paying 2 GBP per night with airport transfers was going to be a bargain whatever. I liked this hotel, although first impressions are not great. No formal reception, just a row of people behind desks. Rooms were for me great. Plenty of rooms, no trendy gimics, everything there and easy to use wth no fuss. Free broadband access from room, a personal security box easy to use, powerful shower and bath. Normal coffee/tea. Even the fangled personal lighting scheme was easy to use and worked. The hotel is used for weddings a lot but that didn't impact us. The staff were great, not starched with forced smiles and silly uniforms, just natural smiles, down to earth and very helpful. Location is just around the corner from raffles and if you can get used to the humidity its possible to walk to many of the tourist haunts. The buffet breakfast was a blend of western/asian, very good value at $22 singapore before 50% discount with Singapore stopover. Evening options were an Asian buffet or western a la carte. Both times when we stayed there western guests were a very small minority., seems to be used a lot by asian tour groups.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nice makeover, but watch out for mould and sewer gas”
Reviews.Author: MareeSydney
Reviews.Content: A good reasonably priced hotel for a few days stop over. Unfortunately we were here for a week. Initial reaction was "small room, nicely re-decorated, but what's that smell??? " Noticed there was what looked like mold on the walls beneath the new wall paper and a sewer gas smell coming from the bathroom. Must admit the other room my colleague was in didn't smell and seemed slightly larger. Nice neutral modern decor. The bedding was good - feather duvets and pillows. No other choices offerred for pillows and they were rather too soft but we survived. Towels were tiny and well used, but clean. Shower over bath was very narrow. Fought with the shower curtain every morning but plenty of hot water and good pressure. Only 3 english tv channels - Channel 5, espn and CNN - no discovery channel , most unusual. There is a broadband outlet in the room but no wifi. You can borrow a cable or use the spare computer in the tiny business centre office at $6 an hour for internet access. The staff were very good, polite and efficient - no complaints. An additional swipe card key was available but not offerred on check-in. We had to ask and pay a $3 cash bond for the 2nd card but it was worth it. If there is an emergency an automated voice message is transmitted thru speakers in the hall ways. I know this as it went off at 7am one morning. We had no idea what it was saying until the "All clear - sorry for the false alarm" message was transmitted. Good thing there wasn't a real fire or bomb scare. Breakfast - Quantity not quality is the focus here. Cereal is either cornflakes or Cocopops, two types of bread for toast, you can get an omlette made on the spot by a chef (which is worth the queue), bacon - lots but dried out and fatty, hash browns (found them on the last day in the asian food section, asian breakfast section - yes, fresh fruit - melons, pineapple, apples (no bananas), apple or orange juice, coffee, tea and warm milk - ewwwww (no cold milk), pastries and yogurt. As I said... lots of food but not the greatest quality. And we also have to add that we sufferred 2 attacks of delhi belly a few hours after eating breakfast on two different days - and it was the only time we all ate the same things. Coincidense maybe??? ...but I don't think so. The buffet dinner was a very cheap $12 per person - but there was significantly less to eat than breakfast and the quality was even worse (if that's possible). We invited people to join us for a meal and were very embarrassed. There is a small gym with a running machine, cross trainer and exercycle - all good quality and in good condition. The pool is hard to find and just a lap pool really. You MUST shower before entering the pool - WHY???? because the signs command it. Eating out - exit the hotel and turn right, walk for 1 block and enter a newish shopping centre on the right. Take the escalator to the 4th floor. Avoid the asian chicken rice place and head for the steak house in the middle. The steak, chips and veges are excellent - but ask for no seasoning unless you adore salt/pepper/paprika for africa on everything. OR exit the lift on level 2 of the hotel, go thru the glass doors into the Allson hotel, exit thru the Allson hotel entrance and turn left. There is a good food court there with lots of local traders or further along the street, diagonally opposite at the traffic lights, under the Intercontinental Hotel there is a great shopping centre with lots of eateries. There is also a huge night market nearby. Turn right coming out of the hotel and walk two blocks. Walk past the fruit shops and the entrance is right there. Great for last minute souvenir and gift shopping. Last advice, bring earplugs as the corridors get noisy with other guests banging doors and talking loudly at any hour of the day or night. Also the aircon is a bit noisy as was the baby crying in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price and great location”
Reviews.Author: Cathy&Gary
Reviews.Content: We booked the Royal@Queens through the Singapore Airlines stopover package and have stayed there 2 years in a row, except this year it was $100 cheaper due to the promotion of first night for $1. So our 5 nights cost us $505 which also includes lots of bonuses such as free transfers, 50% discount on meals at the hotel, free entry into various attractions such as Singapore Zoo, Jurong Bird Park etc. Royal@Queens is a good hotel in a great location; the room is nice with a huge flat screen TV, DVD player, iron and ironing board, tea & coffee making facilities and a big in room safe. It use to be part of the Allyson Hotel and is still connected by a walkway. The hotel is a 5 min walk to Bugis Street, Raffles, Chijmes, City Hall MRT, there is a 7/11 next door, atms and a food court. It also took us about 15 minutes to walk to Little India. If the price was right we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL IN THE CENTER”
Reviews.Author: JENGWOON
Reviews.Content: we came to here for travel and vistedmy soon he worked here. booked room with asia room site. We got duluxe roomand very niceroom. all well done in the room very comfortable beds and very sweet cozy room. I love room here and enjoyed it nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - nothing fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cowsyyy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK. We stayed here because of a deal from Singapore Airlines. The room was spacious and clean. However as the night went on we could smell smoke even though we asked for a non smoking room. Staff at the hotel were really nice and accommodating. We had a flight at midnight and they held our baggage for us till we were ready to go to the airport. They were even accommodating when we asked if we could take a shower before our flight - super nice! I don't know if I'd stay here if we had to pay the full price but would recommend it as a stop over. The hotel is really close to shopping (Orchard road) and other attractions. We found the food in Singapore fabulous - so delicious and cheap. I would recommend eating at one of their food courts - it's not a typical western food court!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: AnuGK
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel in heart of Singapore CBD. Things I like about the hotel:  Very neat and clean with courteous staff  Room was fitted high tech electrical fittings like touch switch for lights with large flat TV  They have one plug which can fit even Indian electrical appliances which was plus point to charge my camera and handycam simultaneously as we had only on e adapter  Near to Raffle city MRT station  Breakfast at hotel was good with lots of varieties We stayed 2 days in Singapore and followed this plan : 1) Evening we reached Singapore and after fresh up headed for Merlion Park. 2) Next day went to Jurong Bird Park till lunch and evening went to Santosa Island. Saw Dolphin Lagoon , Underwater World and Songs of the sea Song of the sea was just fantastic. It is must watch in Singapore. If you are from America or Canada and have seen Dolphin shows there then you can ignore the Dolphin Lagoon show. 3) Went to Zoo. It is also good …. All the animals were clean and looked healthy and active… It would need at least 5 hours to see all the animals and attend the shows. We took MRT Pass on second day of our trip which was 8$ per head . This can be used in trains and buses. This is the best and fastest and cheapest mode of traveling. Get to see city and people and the culture of Singapore. Enjoyed the various cakes and pastries at ‘Breadtalk’ shop present at all the MRTs and bus station. At night, on Day 2 we even went to Mustafa Market… I would say it was a major let down… shop was crowded with people and A/C not working properly. It you are Claustrophobic think before entering this place….!!!! May be it offers good prices… but we felt like as if we are in ‘Big Bazaar’ in India. Fully crowded and people pushing each other. May be we went wrong time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again”
Reviews.Author: ausytraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Royal at Queens hotel before so was more than willing to have a nice stay here again. Even better, singapore stopover holiday presented a special of 1 dollars US to stay at this hotel. However, I was a solo traveller so I paid 75AUD a night instead, which is still good anyway. The rooms were great, comfy beds and clean as ever. Near Raffles city and train station )about 5 minutes walk). I had difficulty in using the DVD player and rang the help desk. They sent someone to fix it, and after about 1 minute, help was there. I would definitely come and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-level hotel with highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandCreature
Reviews.Content: The Royal@Queens is a modern hotel of reasonable quality, aimed at the mid-level business traveller and tourist. Many aspects of the hotel are very good, but it falls down on others. My room was stylishly designed with appearance in mind more than function. Most of the lights were controlled only from a panel next to the bed, meaning one has to walk across the room to switch on or off a nearby light. The armchair was in a dark corner of the room, useless for reading. There was a large flat-screen television, and an in-room safe with a power outlet inside for charging laptops while locked away. High-speed (wired) broadband was included in the cost of the room. The bed was comfortable, and although my room faced the street I heard no traffic noise. Alas, mechanical noises of the building (even with the room's air-conditioning turned off) were so loud as to disrupt sleep; I had to resort to ear-plugs. The curtains were fully light-tight, but the glow of the light-switch panel was sufficient to light up the room like a bright night-light. Bathroom amenities included all the usual little bottles and boxes. The bathroom design was far too hip to have towel rails or lighting adequate for shaving or make-up. The shaving/make-up mirror was badly placed, as was the shower curtain (several centimetres further into the tub than necessary). The breakfast buffet offered plenty of choice, but the quality was mediocre. My primary displeasure was the persistent, and sometimes strong, smell of sewer gas in the bathroom, which I was unable to diagnose. At first I thought that someone was eating durians next door, but it became clear, after a couple of days, that the smell (which was only in the bathroom) was coming from the plumbing. Pouring water down the floor drain, in case it was just due to a dry trap, did not help. (I did not report the problem to management.)

Reviews.Title: “Good value between Colonial Quarter and Little India”
Reviews.Author: Firstfleet
Reviews.Content: I booked and executive room at this hotel on the internet despite some of the poor write ups on this website. There was a mix of good and bad write ups and it appears that it has been renovated recently and some of the older writeups may no longer apply. We had a great stay despite being put into a twin room rather than a double at first. When we explained to the staff they courteously found us a new room immediately. The room was very modern with flat screen TV and clean bathroom, with a safe. There is a lap pool that was quite good even if a little crowded when an Indian family jumped in to join us. The location is good, being only two blocks from Raffles Hotel and not much further to Little India, Orchard Road and the Singapore River. The breakfast is pretty standard, probably aimed more at Chinese than Western tastes but still not too bad. Definitely not 4 star but a good 3 star I would say. Comfortable, not luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “noisy and a bit worn down”
Reviews.Author: keijo
Reviews.Content: stayed there for six nights in june 09. despite a recent renovation, the age of the hotel is visible here and there. i have no other real complaint than the noise of the ventilation devices, perhaps that's a sign of aging. first room was next to the a/c engine room, sounded like sleeping your ear next to a fridge. after complaining about this we got a new room in which, however, the pipes of the a/c device made a very loud rattling noise when a/c was on. if i come back to this place I will want to check for noises before accepting a room and I recommend that anyone not wanting to sleep with earplugs does the same. cleaning didn't seem very thorough - there were hairs in the bathtub. a very good thing: the wired internet was free and relatively fast.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had booked here earlier”
Reviews.Author: Bahmo
Reviews.Content: We had an unexpected need to book a hotel for the last few nights of our trip, and I found a great deal on the service apartment here for S$195++ including breakfast. The service apartment is essentially two connecting hotel rooms, but one of the rooms has been converted into a living room with a full kitchen. We stayed at the Allson back in 2006, and I do not remember being impressed by the connected Royal @ Queens then, but it has clearly undergone a major renovation. Pros: 1) Location. It is a 10-minute walk to either the City Hall MRT station (Raffles City) or the Bugis MRT station (Bugis Junction). There are plenty of shops for the non-Orchard Road shopping experience, and food is everywhere with Chijmes one block away and plenty of restaurants and food courts in the area. Being able to cut through the connected Allson hotel (on the second floor, not first) to get to Victoria Street is nice too. 2) Comfort. The newly refurbished rooms are very comfortable. The service apartment included large, LCD televisions in both the bedroom and living room (only the one in the bedroom included a DVD player). My six-year-old could have amused herself for hours playing with the fancy panels that control all the lights. There was a king-size bed in the bedroom, and the couch folds out into a super-single or double bed. Also, we received a complimentary cot. Thus, there was plenty of room for the 4 of us. Finally, the kitchen included a large (for a hotel room) refrigerator with a separate freezer, a microwave, an oven, a stove, and even a washing machine. 3) Did I mention the washing machine? It took about 3-4 hours to wash and dry one load (the unit does both the washing and drying), but we were so happy to have a place to do our laundry without paying hotel, per piece prices or sending it out to some unknown laundrette. 4) Breakfast. The buffet breakfast we received with the room was not spectacular, but it had a variety of eastern and western foods, was well stocked, and hit the spot. 5) Staff. The reception staff was helpful, allowing us to extend our stay for an extra night at the discount rate we received from booking.com. Even better Cons: 1) Swimming pool. It really is comically small. You access it via the 4th floor, where you can see the Allson's pool. That pool is by no means large, but the pool area itself is nice. By contrast, the pool at the Royal @ Queens seems like an afterthought. After you go outside on the 4th floor, there is one table and a small shower area. You then must climb a flight of stairs to find this sliver of a pool deck. It appears to have a small wading area for kids, but I honestly do not think that it is more than 8-feet wide or 25-feet long. It might give the kids a chance to splash about and cool off, but there will be no swimming or lounging around the pool here. 2) Internet. S$6/hour. Now, I was told on our last day that there was no charge for me to use the internet in the business centre, so it may come with the service apartment. However, when we checked in, we were told that the internet cost S$6/hour. Overall, for the same price we paid for the Holiday Inn Park View, we got almost twice the space, a kitchen, two large televisions, a DVD player, free breakfast, and a similar 8-10 minute walk to the nearest MRT station. Unless the price goes up significantly (or we find a great deal on a 2-bedroom service apartment like Somerset Bencoolen), we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever, again....”
Reviews.Author: AwNeaz
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I stayed in one of the standard rooms. The room was in terrible condition, with old furniture that was not well maintained. The room smelled dank. The carpet in my room was stained. The air conditioner was barely adequate. The real shocker was the bathroom...DISGUSTING! The grout between the floor/shower tiles were covered in mildew. Take a look at the photo I included!

Reviews.Title: “Very overrated. What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews here, I was under the impression the Hotel Royal @ Queens would be a great hotel. Boy was a deceived. This hotel is nowhere close to a 4 star hotel, and I don't see how anyone could think the money you pay for stay here is justified. Let me explain... 1. The hotel staff is dull and inhospitable. They take their time looking the other way when you are standing at the counter waiting to get their attention. 2. The bell-boy doesn't carry your bags, or even help you to your room. At first I thought maybe it was only us, but no. I watched how many people checked in, and was merely pointed towards the elevators. No help here! 3. Room is loud! Everytime someone flushes the toilet in any of the adjacent rooms, there is a loud continuous noise for several minutes. 4. There was something wrong with the phone in our room (it seems). Technicians came to our door right after check-in, and asked to come in to fix the phones, saying we had asked for it to be fixed. I explained we had just checked in and nothing seemed to be wrong with the phone. They insisted on coming in. I said we were resting and if they could return another time. Again, they insisted on coming in. Rude! 5. Internet. I was under the impression that Singapore was a hi-tech country. The hotel doesn't have wi-fi. They will lend you a network cable at the hotel counter for your plugged in browsing experience. Having kids, this is definitely not an idea solution, having a long cable running across the hotel room. And at $6 Singapore Dollars and hour, I feel like I am being robbed. 6. There is a large LCD TV in our room, but the reception is terrible. Lmost every channel has static. 7. Don't be fooled about its location. The Royal @ Queens is a long way from Orchard Road. We're talking at least a 10 minute walk to get to it. At these prices I thought I was getting a 4 star hotel. In reality this is more like a 2.5 star hotel, with unfriendly staff, and insufficient amenities. I wouldn't stay here again. At the price that we paid for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fresh room, great location”
Reviews.Author: DaisyClover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal @ Queens as a Singapore Airlines (SIA) stopover package for A$128. The latest refurbishment of this hotel was completed in September 2008 so our room was looking fresh, modern/minimalist and new. The R @ Q is what used to be the rear tower of the Allson Hotel i.e. the entrance is on Queen Street but the hotels are connected on the first floor. The check-in staff were courteous and efficient. Our room was not large but was comfortable and convenient. It had a comfortable king size bed with feather quilt and pillows, a large flat screen television, mini bar, desk and chair, and an arm chair. The bathroom was small but modern, stylish and convenient with a shower over the bath tub. I have stayed at this hotel over decades and three identities because I love the location. There is a food court next door in Victoria Street and a 24 hour food court opposite. The excellent Singapore Art Museum is a step away on the corner of Queen Street and Bras Basah Road and the National Museum of Singapore is only a block further. The colourful temple street of Waterloo Street is only a block away with the OG department store not much further. The Bugis Street food court and MRT station are also nearby. Beyond what is in the immediate proximity however, this location is a really central point for walking expeditions to almost every district of SIngapore city. If you are on an SIA stopover package, this is better value than the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: shellily
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four and booked connecting executive rooms on the 16th floor. The rooms were supposed to have been newly renovated and the staff seemed very proud to show them off to us!!! But have to say the rooms were amazing. There were touch screen controls for everything - lights, door bell, make up room and do not disturb. Everything could be controlled from the bed side. There was a 40" LCD TV - which did have some problem of being fused out when we arrived but they corrected it very quickly after we mentioned it to them. The bathrooms were great with a tub and very clean. The view from the top was gorgeous and you could a whole lot of the city. We enjoyed looking out of the floor to top windows whenever we had a chance. Beds were soft and lovely, fell asleep as soon as we got into them. Staff were very helpful and would correct anything quickly if we needed. The buffet breakfast the next day had the usual choices. I guess it was the usual, standard fare that is available everywhere – nothing special. We had to wait for a long time almost always to get into the crowded breakfast room as there were many tour groups staying at the hotel. All the days we were there it was really full with many tour groups coming and going. We did order room service for dinner once and have to say the food is terrible here and comes quite a bit of time after ordering, so you would do better to just go to any of the great restaurants in Singapore or even the food courts. We went into one of the food courts once but you better be sure you know what you are getting and ask the locals if it is anything good for a foreign taste as sometimes strange tastes otherwise get into your plates. (Well we do like to experiment with food so would try out new stuff – but some of the food on offer is really strange for foreign tongues). But if you have a local with you, you can get amazing food at the food courts. Back to the hotel, the swimming pool is on the rooftop and is dismally small - like 3 bath tubs put together, so don’t hope for a exercising swim there. However staff overall was quite good. I needed the internet in my room and they had a package which had free internet at the rate we took (200Sing $ per night per room). They gave me an ethernet cable to plug my laptop into but this was broken and so kept disconnecting and after asking for a replacement after rummaging through the wires they gave me another one in the same condition. And in any case the internet connection was not great and kept dropping off and sometimes I couldn’t even get logged in. Well so much for the “free internet.” As someone mentioned yes it is difficult to get a taxi here so it helps sometimes to get the hotel to ring for one earlier on. Its about a 5-15 min walk (depending on how fast you walk ) to get to the Bugis market where there are food courts and shops to look around and shop and also the Bugis Station Mall for more better quality stuff and some good restaurants. So overall a well placed hotel which is a great place to stay but not to eat in. And well placed enough to have things to do around it.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, but hard to get a taxi...”
Reviews.Author: tambalyn
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Royal despite the very bad reviews I am reading here. I banked on the last 2 positive reviews and just hoped for the best. I booked the newly renovated executive room and I wasn't disppointed. The rooms were a bit tiny especially that we had an extra bed, otherwise, i think it would have just been okay. It's got modern furnishing, flat screen TV, comfortable beds and modern finishings in the T&B. the not so good points are: the sliding door to the T&B can be quite difficult to maneuver and many times it got stuck, so we had to contend with taking a shower with the door open. The bathtub didn't have those non-slid stickers and it was quite dangerous to move around, I had to keep on holding on to the shower handle. If you have a child, then you better check this out. The retractable clotheline was a bit located halfway such that if you have it pulled out and u wanna rush to the tub, you might easily get caught up in it, dangerous as well! In the time that we were there, our rooms weren't at all made up each time we got back to the hotel at around 5pm. We had to call the attention of the front desk to make sure our rooms were made up by the time we're back for the night. There was no complimentary bottled water, and I think this was at least basic especially if you have coffee-making facilities. The staff did tell me that it was okay to use tap water, but I guess sometimes, we are wary on drinking tap water. As some poster has said, the biggest disappointment was really the breakfast. It was so bland, not too many choices and just so not appetizing. The "free breakfast" in the package seemed not to have mattered at all. I suggest you go somewhere and have your breakfast, there's kopitiam two blocks down. The hotel is located along a small street and we found it a bit difficult to get a taxi, especially in the early morning. I never had this problem in my previous stays in Singapore in other hotels. The front desk staff wasn't too helpful at all. He never helped us carry our bags nor did he offer to call a cab for us. He simply said it was difficult to get a cab from the hotel. And when I asked why, he just shrugged me off and said "i don't know". Over-all, if these points don't matter that much to you, the hotel is a good place to sleep (just make sure u get the newly-renovated rooms). Be sure to don't expect much from the breakfast nor from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: Kento-san
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night while we were in Singapore. This hotel was well located, within walking distance to CityHall MRT and Bugis MRT - both of which have shopping malls, food courts etc. The room was quiet, spacious and newly renovated, so it was quite comfortable. We are a family of 4, and they provided a baby cot at no extra charge. The only real disappointment was the breakfast - if I had known it was going to be so bland I would have eaten elsewhere. Literally, all of the food we had, had no taste. Overall, I would probably stay here again, as it was reasonably priced and the staff were courteous.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: Moonraker_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on Singapore Airlines stopover and found this hotel much better than some of the earllier reviews suggest. The room was fine - looked to be recently refurbished - and building noise didnt affect us (there was a building site next door which would affect rooms on one side of the hotel). Staff helpful and polite. Restauarant limited but there are plenty of eating places round about - the hotel is very centrally located. Found it to be good base for touring the city. Looked similar to many other modern hotels in this part of the city

Reviews.Title: “two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: travelandfashion
Reviews.Content: we booked an Executive Room and it was perfect! touch screen light controls, door bell, make up room and do not disturb light signs. 40" LCD TV clean bathroom with tub and shower soft comfy beds good customer service. attends to your needs/complaints immediately. affordable and worth the stay. see uploaded pictures of our executive room on traveler's photo section

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: RossOrpington
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Executive rooms during the Singapore airshow in February 2008. We booked it using the hotel website and got an excellent deal. The hotel room was very comfortable, spacious and clean. Renovations were taking place during the day but these could be mostly ignored. We were sightseeing most of the day so the work had little effect on us. There was a good selection at the buffet breakfast - you'd have to be very fussy not to find good edible food. The staff were very polite, friendly and eager to please. The one criticism of the hotel was the archaic system they used for hotel guests accessing the hotel's internet facilities in their business centre. The location of the hotel was great, being near Raffles and the Chimes restaurants. Also the metro was within easy walking distance as were many bus routes. We had a wonderful time and would certanily return to that hotel and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Gasbag150
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as I had a night in "transit" with Singapore Airlines. What a disappointment!! Singapore Airlines really ought to ditch this Hotel as a strategic Partner. The place is awful. I stayed in Room 540 and it really was quite poor - and I'd actually been looking forward to staying in one of those plush Singapore Hotels I'd heard and read about on the web!! The plumbing was noisy, the shower nozzle sprayed water everywhere and frankly the restaurant was devoid of any choice on the menu. The oriental food I chose was disgusting. Stay well away from the Royal @ Queens - there can't be any worse options!!

Reviews.Title: “You can find better I'm sure”
Reviews.Author: SallyElephant
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a renovated room which I must say was very nice. However there were renovations from about 9am to 5pm and because of the heat we went back to "relax" in the hotel each day. The 'included' breakfast is the worst I have ever had and I've travelled throughout Asia and Africa in various classes of hotels. After the first morning we ate around the corner at another cafe. This appears to be a hotel for tour groups and often people were yelling in the corridors at other people. I wouldn't recommend this hotel and am sure you could find better for the price. Location was good however.

Reviews.Title: “Run for your life”
Reviews.Author: DrWho08
Reviews.Content: The state of this hotel was absolutely shocking and it DOES NOT reflect what you see on their website. It is undergoing renovations and you have to put up with stereo jack hammering from 8am till 6pm. If that is not enough to scare you, try the moldy bathroom, dirty carpets, stained lamp shades, peeling wall paper and the list goes on. I can't believe that they can charge S$230-$450 as their standard rates, that's absurd given the general condition of the hotel. We got a special rate of S$128 per night, but we were NOT told that they are undergoing renovations. What a shock to hear the jack hammers first thing in the morning. The airport taxi driver said it the best as he drove into the drive way of the hotel, "so this is the hotel, hey I haven't driven anyone here to such a long time." After the first night, we checked out never to return.

Reviews.Title: “great location but not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: tlove63
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on a Singapore airlines stopover deal in October 2007. The check in service was great, friendly & helpful concierge and tour desk staff. Although the room was dated and older style it was clean & comfortable. Room service was cheap and great food. Loved the breakfast buffet, great selection of food. Really liked the location, easy walk to Raffles, hop on/off bus, 7/11 store and hawker stalls/night market right next door. This hotel connects with the Allson on floor 2 so you can take a short cut through Allson instead of walking around the block. I would stay here again however have booked 2 rooms for my family at Allson for December 2008 holiday-similar price but a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: carlbond1982
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of bad reviews for this hotel, But the 5 nights me and my wife stayed there, we had an enjoyable stay. The rooms were old but comfortable, the bathroom was well worn, that would be the only thing that i could say that i was not happy with. The service was great and the breakfast was even better, it was a feast of bacon, eggs, rice , noddles, cereal and to many more to name. Great value for money and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumitchennai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is terrible, i could hear all the toilets on my floor. No one ever seems to pick up the room service phone, the breakfast was cold, they dont give messages, theres a jack hammer running all day, the hot water is cold. Pls dont stay here. You have to be out of mind if u stay here after u hear about my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Desparately needs upgrading”
Reviews.Author: TPTVancouver_B_C_
Reviews.Content: This was an overnight stopover arranged by Singapore Airlines. Because it was only one night, and we weren't paying for it directly, we could put up with it, but I would never pay the posted rates to stay there. The room we stayed in costs S$250. The room was okay in size, but it smelled of stale smoke. The bathroom tiles were mouldy. There are nice details in the woodwork, and there is a good hawker centre around the block, but these are not enough to make me want to stay here again. A note in the room said they are upgrading the rooms, floor by floor. One can only hope the upgrades will make the hotel worthy of what they're charging.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: BikolanaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of negative reviews about the hotel but when I stayed there in June 27-30, 2007, I found that the hotel was not that bad at all. I was asked to deposit S$50 to cover for any incidentals that were not included in my package. We were a party of three and we were billeted at a non-smoking area in the 12th floor. The room was clean and the tv, ref, phone, aircon and lights were all functioning well. The faucet and shower in the bathroom were all working well also. Everyday, our room was clean up and we had fresh supplies of toiletries. The breakfast was buffet and the food choices were just enough to cater to different tastes of the different international travelers. Overall, our stay at the hotel was comfortable. And if I return to Singapore on a limited budget, I will still prefer the hotel as it is a few blocks away to City Hall MRT station, Chjimes, Raffles Hotel, Bugis and Suntec.

Reviews.Title: “Poor accomodations”
Reviews.Author: filipinatourist
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews of this hotel and tried to ask our travel agent not to book us with this hotels , but she said Singapore then was full ( better to book through the internet). Anyway, we were a party of 20. The rooms given to us were all smoking rooms, inspite of the request for nonsmoking rooms. The employees were kind to transfer us the following day to better smelling rooms. But the bathrooms had stains on the floor, would flood when one takes a bath, the rubber mats looked old and filthy. There was a night when the hotel had a power brownout, and we could not go into our rooms, until we asked that the manager bring us into the room with his key - ..The saving factor of this hotel is its staff. Otherwise, there are better hotels in Singapore...

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Royal@Queens Singapore”
Reviews.Author: beforeIdie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Royal@Queens in Singapore, this hotel is registered as a 4 Star hotel, I doubt whether this hotel would rate a 2 Star compared to the other 4 Star hotels we have stayed in in the region of Thailand and malaysia, our reception was "I couldnt care less ", the room was clean and adequate and situated in a central area, the bathroom was out of this world, or should have been, definitely dodgy. the Dining Room wouldnt have made a good transport cafe it was so bad and the food that was served was equally as bad, no table cloths and the waiter had your plates away before you had finished. On the day that we were leaving we asked if we could keep the room on because we had a 2045 pick up, Answer. No. did they have facilities for guests to have a shower or wash, Answer No, on leaving no goodbye or please come again. We were glad to be out of it, unfortunately the saga didnt finish there, on arriving home in the U.K. I find my credit card had been debited to an amount to which I had no part in, fortunately my bank saw this and stopped it, however, I was left without my credit card for 7 working days, who had the card besides me, the Royal@Queens were the only ones .DONT USE .

Reviews.Title: “it is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: orangepig
Reviews.Content: The tub of the bathroom was clipping and dirty. My collegues even did not dare to step on it to have a shower. The bathroom floor is also dirty which has a black mark on the white tiles. The air smells "old". All the furnishings should be changed completely.

Reviews.Title: “Royal At Queens.. Avoid like Cobras, SARS or Bird Flu!”
Reviews.Author: BBloke
Reviews.Content: There is no polite way to say that this place is a dump! When alternate choices are available.... take them. Actually the gutter outside was probably cleaner. $8 for a can of $3 beer in the bar fridge! Bed head falling down! Wall paper falling off! No handles on windows! Lighting switches connected to incorrect lights! The bathroom mushrooms were a nice touch! Price gouging staff for van hire! ---Sleeping under a bench at Maxwell street markets would be more fun, probably cleaner, definitely cheaper.--- I was even jealous of the animals at Singapore zoo. They were in better quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, not really great”
Reviews.Author: Cheerful_mama
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Royal at Queens was just plain okay. It's nothing spectacular and there were some problems with the hotel. First, the walls in our room needed repainting (or a thorough cleaning). There was a yellowish substance on the walls that kinda looked gross (I think old paint has chipped off) and the sink in the toilet was a little clogged. Housekeeping also left a wet towel (that we didn't use!) on top of our luggage, so of course, our luggage got wet! There was also this irritating housekeeping lady that kept on pressing our doorbell while shouting "housekeeping!" and so she woke up our tired little baby who was napping!! Can't she just buzz once and wait for a reply rather than push the doorbell again and again?!? Breakfast was again, just ok. Food was plentiful but it wasn't the best. I loved the orange juice though, and the staff there was quite polite. Location-wise, it's okay since it's right behind Allson and there's a good enough foodcourt beside it. Bugis and OG were quite near, although the 10-15 minute walk was kinda tiring if you're carrying a little baby. Overall, Royal at Queens is a little below average. It's definitely not a 4-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but the hotel stinks!”
Reviews.Author: Freshjive_Adelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal on a Singapore Stopover trip. The location was great, it was near the Bugis Street markets and a street away from a 24 hour foodcourt (very good and cheap hawker's food!). However the hotel was in such a terrible state. My room smelled of mold and dampness (like the carpet was wet for a couple of weeks!). The bathroom was such a disaster with cracks on the walls, the vanity and the toilet basin. The hotel staff were abit clueless as to what was happening during the morning. One staff told me the hotel cafe won't open till 10:00 am, as I had an early flight I was at the lobby at 7 am and behold the cafe was serving a buffet breakfast. I did have my breakfast and went to pay, no one was at the cashier, the kitchen staff told me to go away as she didn't want to take my money. I had to literally look for someone who worked in the hotel and gave her the payment for my breakfast! Would not stay there again. And did I mention that everyone staying at the hotel seem to be smoking!

Reviews.Title: “Less than 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of June this year. It was part of a package with Singapore Airlines. We paid for 3 adults (husband, wife and 14 year old daughter): we were given a double room with an extra bed which effectively meant that you could not walk in the room or store your luggage. On asking reception about these appalling arrangements they were very aloof and unconcerned that they had unhappy guests. Finally, the lobby manager offered us an upgrade to the suite. We paid the difference though I think we would have been better off in another hotel. The suite was more spacious. However, 1. The bathroom which is not 4 star standards leaked. 2. The bed linen was old with blankets that probably hailed from world war 2. 3. The night frills had awful stains which housekeeping said they could not change. 4. The breakfast was definitely not 4 star standard. 5. The website of the hotel and pictures there are very misleading. Would not recommend this especially if you think that this is a 4 star hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Royal at Queens
HotelInfo.Address: 12 Queen Street, Singapore 188553, Singapore
